dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image is spectacular, aglow in DUSK LIGHT: a beautifu just born, held in a WOMAN'S HANDS. It is being cleaned; water runs down its face and body. TIGHT ON the MIDWIFE (female, 60's) who holds and cleans baby as it CRIES. Another, younger, Midwife can be seen b her, assisting with the pitchers of water. As she cleans baby, she says to someone OFF-CAMERA:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is strong. The baby, now calm, gets SWADDLED.    He is then gently h to the new MOTHER: AMANDA GRAYSON, late 20's. An original beauty. She lies o divan, spent but eager to hold her first child. She tende takes the infant into her arms, tears in her eyes, mesmer She holds the wrapped baby tight and whispers sweetly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... hello. CLOSE ON the YOUNGER MIDWIFE, standing at the rear of the She raises an eyebrow as she quietly speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby is healthy. Why does she cry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is human. A distant, quiet BUZZ -- and the elder Midwife stands, lo into the distance. And this is when we see, for the first that the Midwife has POINTED EARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarek arrives. The Midwife moves away -- we PUSH IN on Amanda, who looks a moment, clearly disquieted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A planet of massive, tortured ROCK FORMS, distant cities constructed atop and underneath them. A HOVER-SPEEDER in mid-ground kicks up dust, backlit by the sun, as it trace horizon. We PAN WITH IT, revealing a FAMILY HOME, built seamlessly into a rocky mountainside. A SUPER READS: STARDATE 2230.06. The speeder parks outside the home --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAREK (late 40's, a Vulcan) comes out to the balcony thro rear doors of the home. He moves to Amanda and kneels. He looks at the child -- his child -- and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done. She looks at him for a beat, then says, flatly -- with ju enough rancor:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. He regards her.   Knows he's in TROUBLE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your tone suggests disappointment. The Science Council required my presence for a session regarding--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that.     You knew I wanted you here. The Vulcan Midwives share a look. Sarek glances at them. The two women excuse themselves. Sarek reaches over, touc small touchpad -- the HARPSICHORD MUSIC STOPS. He says, clinically:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you are aware, the Vulcan male is traditionally not present at the moment of delivery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well traditionally, I'm not the one giving birth. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I moved here -- to another planet -- to be with you. I needed you to be with me today. Holding my hand and telling me I'm doing great, even when I'm just... breathing the best I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sad that she has to tell him this at all, she just looks the baby -- finding comfort in his innocence. Sarek consi this. He moves closer to her. Whispers intimately:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are correct. I should have been here. I am sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with her free hand, she pulls Sarek closer -- and kis him. And the two look at the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a thought. That we might name the child after one of our respected early society-builders. His name was "Spock".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the baby, not immediately taken by the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your silence does not suggest enormous enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Spock. (smiles, touches his face) ... Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Sarek: Spock it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child has your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls back the baby's swaddling, revealing his ears. gently rubs the top of his right ear -- AND IT UNFURLS, revealing a small, soft pointed VULCAN EAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and your ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And off the image of this TINY BABY, half-human, half-Vul we... FADE OUT. And over BLACKNESS, we BEGIN TO HEAR an A SOUNDING -- GROWING -- and the SUPER "THREE YEARS LATER" -- and finally the BLACKNESS IS SPLIT BY TURBO-LIFT DOORS OPENING and we REVEAL THAT WE'RE ON:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With URGENCY, we MOVE DOWN a corridor with CAPTAIN ROBAU

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN ROBAU OFFICER PITTS
dialogues.text: -- our sensors haven't made        -- no sir, it looked l sense of the anomaly?              lightning storm in the -- how far are we from the         of space -- Klingon Neutral Zone?              -- 150,000 kilometers, vessel is not Klingon, Sir, its registry doesn't match any recorded profile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHWISH! The doors part and we enter THE BRIDGE OF THE SHI flurry of activity -- the MASSIVE SHIP they are approachi the VIEWSCREEN. Robau moves to the center -- then he asks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report. -- turning to the ship's FIRST OFFICER: 32, all-American swiveling in a console chair to FACE US:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, new contact bearing zero-three-four.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN ROBAU FIRST OFFICER
dialogues.text: Are they transmitting on any       Negative, Captain -- a frequency?                         communications appear shut down.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN ROBAU FIRST OFFICER
dialogues.text: Hail the ship. What's the          Nothing even close, Si closest match on registry? Robau moves to Pitts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any response?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Sir -- hails met with silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they're incapable -- any identifiable damage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, Sir -- but our readings seem confused--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- not only is the ship unregistered -- but even its construction materials seem unrecognizable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robau sits in the captain's chair his eyes on the ship as approach -- and we SEE IT on the VIEWSCREEN -- THE NARADA ENORMOUS AND THREATENING. He doesn't even realize that he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... oh my God... (to himself, boggled) A lightning storm... then this... (to deck) Signal all departments: first contact protocols. Looks like we have someone new on the block. All Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the endless vacuum of space, and in TOTAL SILENCE, Kelvin appears as a dot, coming to a stop in front of the gigantic BLACK CLAW that is the Narada --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crew members are glued to their telemetry, working consol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, should we initiate an invasive scan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could be seen as an act of provocation -- all readings passive--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a WARNING BEEP --

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PITTS CAPTAIN ROBAU
dialogues.text: Sir, I have a reading -- they've locked weapons on us!     -- Red alert!   Arm wea ALARMS BLARE -- LIGHTS GO RED as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Narada FIRES a TORPEDO -- IT HEADS FOR THE KELVIN -- SEPARATES, fracturing into a multi-hit projectile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officers SCRAMBLE, brace for impact --

dialogues.speaker: FIRST OFFICER CAPTAIN ROBAU
dialogues.text: Torpedo locked on us at 320 degrees, mark two -- incoming      -- Evasive pattern Del fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A direct hit SMASHES several decks along the DISH of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the massive Engine Room, a HUGE BLAST -- MEN GO FLYING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Robau helps a fallen CREW MEMBER up from the floo then, on his chair com.:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damage report! INTERCUT with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving with the Kelvin's CHIEF ENGINEER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our shields did nothing, Sir! Never seen anything like it! Weapons off-line! Main power at 38 percent! As the crew regains their footing, the First Officer pull himself to his console, true fear in his eyes as he place inter-ship call -- it's RINGING -- his fear grows with ev passing RING -- then, we INTERCUT WITH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN, 25, answers her communicator -- she lies on an e table, afraid -- and pregnant. This is WINONA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what was that-- what's happening?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the First Officer is just relieved that she's still a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you're okay-- thank God-- where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medical bay-- I had a few close contractions-- I'm fine-- what was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sit tight-- stay there-- we'll be fine--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe not:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're firing another, Captain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER NARADA TORPEDO -- it SEPARATES, pieces HIT the Ke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Engineer RUNS past us -- CONSUMED BY A SUDDEN EXPLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEMALE CREW MEMBER running down the hall suddenly HOLDS a HOLE IS RIPPED IN THE HALL -- and she's YANKED OUT OF T CORRIDOR -- the CAMERA finally getting sucked out too!

dialogues.speaker: HELMSMAN OFFICER PITTS
dialogues.text: -- life support failing on           -- this is the U.S.S decks seven through thirteen!        attemping to reach S We have confirmed casualties,        command on subspace! Sir!                                 U.S.S. Kelvin, under

dialogues.speaker: FIRST OFFICER TACTICAL OFFICER
dialogues.text: -- shields at eleven percent         -- were our shields and dropping! Ten percent --         That was like nothin we're at nine! Eight percent!        ever seen -- this sh Seven! We're dropping here!          take another hit lik Six!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All remaining power to forward shields! Prepare the shuttles f--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he STOPS. They all do. A fucking FACE is now on their VIEWSCREEN. A ROMULAN FACE -- the FIRST OFFICER of the Na whom we'll come to know as AYEL:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My commander requests the presence of your captain in order to negotiate a cease-fire. You will come aboard our ship via shuttlecraft. Your refusal would be unwise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screen goes DEAD. All eyes on Robau... and he feels them. tense, horrible moment. Finally, to the First Officer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The First Officer follows Robau OFF THE BRIDGE AND INTO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk, briskly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't report within fifteen minutes, execute general order 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we could issue a mayday call to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened, but firm) There is no help for us out here. If we're going down, we're taking them with us -- you save as many as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aye, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robau heads into a waiting TURBOLIFT, turns -- they lock knowing what this means. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Captain now. Mr. Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.   And we realize this is GEORGE KIRK, Jim's fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes on Kirk as he enters -- moves to the captain's c Sits. Not a small moment. Speaking his first words as Cap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Pitts. Transfer Robau's vital signs to the main view screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir. In a moment, Robau's VITAL SIGNS appear on various monito his HEART RATE, OXYGEN LEVELS, BLOOD PRESSURE, all of it. PITCHED BEEPBEEP of his HEARTBEAT is now HEARD --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitals on line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly awkward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TILT DOWN as the TURBO-LIFT DESCENDS -- we PUSH IN as the open and Captain Robau gets out -- moves quickly -- hurri a SHUTTLE BAY catwalk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robau enters a shuttle -- LIGHTS BLINK to life.   He move cockpit -- starts the vehicle up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer, initiate departure sequence. A LOUD HISS and the craft SHUDDERS as it disembarks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparks dripping from the ceiling, everyone is motionless on the monitors -- and we're TIGHT ON GEORGE KIRK -- the of Robau's heart might as well be representing his own. H realizes he's sweating -- wipes his forehead as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttle's pulling out of main bay, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see him -- floodlights please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two MASSIVE FLOODLIGHTS on the Kelvin's dish GO HOT -- an FLARING out the lens -- landing on the SHUTTLE as it leav KELVIN, heading toward the imposing Narada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backlit by the distant floodlights, Robau remains steely- he moves for the darkened ship -- nerves --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Robau's HEARTBEAT QUICKENS -- the tension they all fe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His heart rate's elevated--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's brave.    That's what he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robau watches as he gets closer, the BEEPBEEPING HEARD ov SOUNDS of the shuttle -- but then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL WE HEAR IS THE LOW-PITCHED BEEPBEEP as the small shut seems to get swallowed up by the massive forward-facing s of the Narada -- the distant floodlights creating EERIE S everywhere. A gigantic IRIS DOOR TURNS, SLOWLY OPENS -- a shuttle enters the Narada's main HANGAR -- the door CLOSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And everyone is just motionless and silent. Only Robau's SIGNS can be HEARD, BEEPING away. George's eyes glued ahe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON ROBAU as he faces the shuttle door, considering fate. Finally the SHUTTLE DOOR OPENS -- standing there ar eight ROMULAN GUARDS, brandishing WEAPONS. He steps down. grab him, hard -- he's SCANNED -- FRISKED -- PULLED ALONG we REVEAL the absolutely MASSIVE HANGAR, the insane archi of the interior of this dark, wet, dripping ship --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robau is led into the enormous, dark bridge. A dozen Romu at controls. Robau does his level best to portray confide he is led up a walkway to AYEL. Behind him, sitting silho and motionless, turned away and looking off, is his capta presence always felt in this scene. This is NERO. Ayel touches a panel, then THROWS AN IMAGE into the air b Robau. A ROTATING HOLOGRAM OF A UNIQUE-LOOKING SPACECRAFT will refer to it as the JELLYFISH).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you familiar with this craft? Robau regards it.   Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is your commander? (silence, then re: Nero)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will speak only to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then ask your commander what right he has to attack a Federation vessel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was hardly an attack. My commander will easily destroy your ship. If you do not respond to the question. Robau considers the hologram again.     And what his answ mean for the fate of his crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen it. Or any ship like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you familiar with -- or better, know the location of -- Ambassador Spock? Ayel has thrown another HOLOGRAM -- A FLOATING, ROTATING OF SPOCK, who appears to be 75 earth-years old. The baby, just three years earlier. Robau is as confused as we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am unfamiliar with Ambassador Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A final question. What is the current stardate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the fuck?) ... Stardate? ... it's 2233.04. (finally) ... hey, where are you from--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly: TSCHING! Nero's activated his STAFF -- FOUR LAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE... Robau's vitals go dead.      PUS KIRK as a SCREAMING ALARM IS HEARD --

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PITTS GEORGE KIRK
dialogues.text: They're launching again!           Evasive! Evasive! Delt maneuver! Fire full-spread!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kelvin BANKS as it FIRES WILDLY -- another TORPEDO BL FROM THE NARADA -- it SEPARATES -- some miss, OTHERS HIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debris FLIES TROUGH THE CEILING, SLAMMING INTO A BRIDGE S BEAM! Green COOLANT SPEWS from under the floor grating --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm initiating General Order 13! Set self-destruct for maximum matter- antimatter yield! Two minute countdown!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want auto-pilot targeted for their fuel cells!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, unable to locate the ship's power source!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then just target the damn thing dead center!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got bigger problems: the first hit destroyed auto-pilot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way we're gonna ram that ship is to fly manual control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON GEORGE as this lands.      More honorable than t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- then I'll do it myself -- get to the shuttles, now! (no one moves until:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agony in the faces as they reluctantly hurry off -- Kirk the Captain's chair, hits the COMLINK:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All decks, this is the Captain speaking -- evacuate the ship immediately, get to your designated shuttle crafts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE FAST around Winona, in fucking labor now -- being transferred onto a wheelchair by the Doctor and Nurse--

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE KIRK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- repeat: evacuate ship and get to designated shuttles           -- that's George's v NOW!                                 what's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're packing it up -- you'll deliver in the shuttle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and she's on the move, out the door as her COMMUNICATO SOUNDS -- she answers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- George!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone now on the bridge, piloting this massive craft by h - George talks to Winona from the Captain's chair --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have medical shuttle 37 standing by, get to it now -- can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD ON GEORGE for a moment as he hesitates -- his eyes g the screens as he pilots --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-- and George, it's coming-- our baby, it's coming now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN on him, his heart shattering -- having to out-man incoming torpedoes, piloting the ship to its doom -- stil forces optimism:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you in a minute, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disconnects -- another ALARM -- he TURNS the ship, FIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kelvin BANKS AGAIN -- its PHOTONS SLAMMING INTO THE O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CREW MEMBERS scramble to their shuttles as the ship TREMB and we find WINONA among them, being PUSHED through the m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Med-Team ARRIVES with Winona in the wheelchair-- it's - and for Winona, a huge contraction --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Agh!   That was-- that was a big one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as they put her into the shuttle bed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep breathing, Honey, you're gonna be just fine--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the pain) -- the baby, too, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the baby too.

dialogues.text: SECONDS...) and another reads IMPACT PROXIMITY (36,054 ME 36,042, 36018...).

dialogues.text: Captain to shuttle 37 -- is my wife on board?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOT is readying the controls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir, she is--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to go now, d'you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're waiting for you, Sir--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-- go, take off, immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... yessir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shuttle Pilot works the controls -- and Winona, in the ba feels the shuttle SHUDDER --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! We can't go, my husband isn't here yet! Please! STOP--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but she's suddenly WINCING as another CONTRACTION hits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll need to push now-- are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clamps holding the shuttle SLAM BACK, the MED-SHUTTLE DRO HARD, FUSION IMPULSE ENGINES IGNITE and the shuttle MOVES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George hits COMLINK -- a TONE -- then WINONA'S VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttle's leaving-- where are you? As George EVADES ENEMY FIRE, heading for the massive alie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My love?   Listen carefully, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winona, holding her communicator --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we're about to have this baby --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart... I'm not going to be able to be there. And she just stares -- realizing what's happening -- that been made Captain -- that there was an evacuation -- and she just KNOWS. Tears come to her eyes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no-- no, no-- wait--

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE KIRK WINONA
dialogues.text: I want you to hear me. Please.                           Are you still on the sh -- There's no other way-- my      - no, you need to be he love-- you know all I want--      -- George, I can't do t all I want in the world is to     without you-- be with you--                        (crying now) -- please -- don't d--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but she's WINCING AGAIN --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay-- you need to push. -- and she does -- the shuttle BANKS and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and the shuttle LEAVES the Kelvin bay -- turning to jo DOZENS of other shuttles, all heading off in escape --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As George PILOTS, DODGING INCOMING -- we INTERCUT WITH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winona PUSHING -- giving birth to their baby -- and we're AND FORTH between a husband and wife that will never see other again, MUSIC SWELLING as the Kelvin TURNS HARD, avo TORPEDOES -- the shuttle BANKING as the Doctor and Nurse Winona -- and we're ON GEORGE as he HEARS A BABY CRYING - TEARS COME TO HIS EYES -- as he says--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   Hey, so what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it's a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a boy?   Yeah? And now we see Winona, handed this beautiful little boy. she cries, just looking at him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me... tell me about him-- please--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's-- he's beautiful, he looks like you. Heartsick, George laughs -- glances at the MONITORS -- SE DESTRUCT COUNTDOWN IS AT T-MINUS 20 SECONDS -- oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, you should be here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know-- so what should we call him, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could name him after your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiberius? Are you kidding me? No, that's the worst-- we'll name him after your dad-- let's call him Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Jim.   Jim it is. Through the VIEWSCREEN -- he's ABOUT TO HIT -- the ship A within the enormous Narada blades -- George scared now --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE KIRK WINONA
dialogues.text: Sweetheart? Sweetheart? I love you. Can you hear me?          -- yes-- yes, I hear -- I love you. I love y-- -- his VOICE CUT OFF as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the Kelvin SLAMS INTO THE NARADA -- an EXPLOSION BEGIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George's voice goes STATIC -- confusion washes over her f suddenly LIT BY A BRIGHT GLOW -- she looks over, with wet devastated eyes -- -- what she sees is the MASSIVE EXPLOSION -- quickly SUCK in the vacuum of space -- and she's CRYING -- holding her baby who just lost a father -- his life altered forever..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttle SAILS AWAY with the others... HOLD ON THIS... long beat. Then PAN OVER to see NERO'S SHIP TUMBLING SILE THROUGH SPACE -- DEBRIS still raining from the explosion

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAYHEM: ALARMS and CREW work to stabilize the ship (OVERL ROMULAN DIALOG TO BE WRITTEN) -- we arrive at Nero, who, small specks of HUMAN BLOOD on his face, just STARES at t fucking HOLOGRAM OF SPOCK -- he's OBSESSED. Ayel works a monitor, yelling out something (in Romulan) of their men -- and as a result:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gargantuan "BLADES" EXTEND from the ship like otherworldl -- and the ship begins to STEADY -- but then ANOTHER SHIP APPEARS -- DECLOAKING FROM NOTHINGNESS: a fucking KLINGON -- then ANOTHER -- AND ANOTHER --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're on Ayel as he witnesses, on his monitor, ships, popping up ALL AROUND THEM -- which is when they HEAR a V speaking KLINGON -- and we SUBTITLE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trespassing vessel: you have entered the jurisdiction of the Klingon Empire. Power down and prepare to be boarded or you will be destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes wide, Ayel turns to Nero, still staring at Spock's i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED, in Romulan) Commander Nero -- we're surrounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally Nero looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED, in Romulan) Sir-- what are your orders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we PUSH IN ON NERO as our MUSIC BUILDS, then we CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a young VULCAN BOY. 11 years old. SPOCK. He's standing in an abstract space -- IMAGES PROJECTED and HOV questions -- that he's answering as they appear, then dis

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE SPOCK
dialogues.text: What is the square root of 2,396,304?                          -- one-thousand-five- forty-eight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Correct. What is the central assumption of Quantum       -- everything that ca Cosmology?                          does happen, in equal parallel universes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Correct. Identify the 20th century earth composers of the following musical progression:      -- Paul McCartney and Lennon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Correct And we find ANOTHER VULCAN CHILD -- then ANOTHER -- all i odd spaces -- until we PULL BACK WIDE to reveal a large V LEARNING CENTER -- white "bowls", sunk into the dark grou where PROFESSORS walk, hands behind their backs, surveyin mass "mental martial arts" test. We're on ANOTHER VULCAN CHILD as she gets an answer wrong THE LIGHT OVER HER BOWL GOES OUT. Then ANOTHER CHILD -- w gets an answer wrong -- and HIS LIGHT GOES OUT. An EXTREM WIDE OVERHEAD SHOT reveals BOWL AFTER BOWL as the LIGHTS

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Until only one bowl remains. Spock's. He finishes his las question. Gets it right. PUSH IN ON HIM as the COMPUTER S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your score is one-hundred percent. Congratulations. Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off his face, we CUT TO MOMENTS LATER, as Spock collects things. As he does, three young VULCAN BULLIES walk up be him. Spock glances at them, then back to his things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I presume you've prepared new insults for today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother lies with many men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock just NODS.   Tries to ignore the fact that IT STING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no such information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are neither human, nor Vulcan -- and therefore, have no place in the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallowing that too) This is your thirty-fifth attempt to elicit an emotional response from me. Logic dictates you would cease by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. He has human eyes. They look sad, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps an emotional response requires physical stimuli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bully #2 PUSHES Spock -- who stumbles back, almost fa into one of the bowls. He looks up as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a traitor, you know. Your father. For marrying her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock stares -- we see him fighting the urge, but he's un

dialogues.speaker: AND HE CHARGES THE BULLY AND TACKLES HIM INTO THE BOWL
dialogues.text: land inside -- Spock cries, flailing as he punches Bully The other two stand atop the bowl, stunned -- shocked -- what the hell to do -- and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Spock, chastened, sitting glumly on a bench. A m VULCAN CITY seen through the window behind him. His paren ARGUE at a distance down the hall:

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA SAREK
dialogues.text: -- where I'm from, when someone hits you, you hit back- - how is that not logical?         -- Spock had no reason -- They pick on him -- they        expectation of being tease him -- every day.            physically injured -- -- Which is precisely when reason must guide his actions

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I want him to embrace           above all. Vulcan, you know that... but he has to be himself-- which means, occasionally, being         -- His "humanity" is v human.                             source of his ostracis -- When Vulcans get disgusted with each other, they never just walk away, do they?           -- No. -- Well humans do. And Amanda walks away, leaving Sarek standing there. He t sees his son down the corridor. Approaches. And we're PUS IN on Spock, studying the fear in his eyes. His father st front of him, looming there, looking down stoically:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not mean to create conflict between you and mother. After a beat, Sarek seems to soften a little.     No ange face. Takes a seat beside his son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In marriage... conflict is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... constant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natural. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emotions run deep within our race. In many ways, more deeply than in humans. Long ago, they nearly destroyed us... that is why we followed the teachings of Surak. Now you must choose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... between you and mother? 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never, my son. But you may choose the ethic of logic. Logic offers a serenity humans seldom experience. The control of feelings... so that they do not control you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They called you a traitor. (then) You suggest that I should be completely Vulcan... and yet you married a human... why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarek is clearly conflicted by this.      But he holds st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ambassador to Earth, my duty is to observe and understand human behavior. Marrying your mother... was logical. (Spock seems disquieted) Spock. You are fully capable of choosing your own destiny. The question you are faced with... is which path you will take. This is something only you can decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM -- a door opens: 14 year-old GEORGE KIRK, JR. angrily the house, carrying a duffel. His angrier, redneckier UNC FRANK following. 11 year-old JIM KIRK nervously pursues t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead: go-- run away! You know I could give a damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- wait-- no!    Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anywhere but here, far as I can get!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which won't be far enough -- know what your problem is?! (big luggie spit) No one ever taught you respect! How to follow orders! Do as you're told! (to Jim) -- what the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-- I just don't want my brother to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I do-- and I asked you to wash the car! How many damn times do I need to repeat myself?! How many damn times? How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glare to George and Frank walks off. Jim nervously foll his brother, pulling out a small, FLOATING DISC --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stay-- you can have my Flo-Yo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George hits it away:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't about toys, it's Uncle Frank. I can't take him anymore -- Mom has no idea what he's like when she's not here-- d'you hear him talking like he's our dad?! And that's not even his car you're washing! That was Dad's car! You know why you're washing it? Because he's gonna sell it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave -- okay? We can tell Mom when she gets back from Africa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone for five more months, by then I'll be in a different system. (sees fear in Kirk) You're gonna be okay. You always are. Always doing everything right -- good grades and obeying every stupid order... (then) I can't be a Kirk in this house. Show me how to do that and I'll stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jim can offer nothing. George gives him a quick hug a walks off. Jim sadly watches his brother go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk washes a VINTAGE CORVETTE. Red, white top. Dumping t sponge in bucket, he's sadly cleaning, his mind spinning his brother's departure. Devastated. And he's wiping the soapy passenger window (SQEEEEEEAK!) the sponge, when he STOPS -- seeing the KEYS in the ignit PUSH IN ON HIS FACE as a devilish idea comes to his mind. LAP A LOUD SCREECH and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE CORVETTE BLASTS ONTO SCREEN, FISHTAILING ONTO THE ROA
dialogues.text: young Jim Kirk behind the wheel (NOTE: The SOUND of the e is a metallic WHIR -- not a gas engine). TIGHT ON JIM'S F he drives -- having never done this before, he's as nervo he is determined --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CORVETTE SPEEDS -- while inside the car, Jim turns on updated, modified RADIO -- scans stations, momentarily lo control of the car -- but he's back on track as he finds ROCK SONG -- and HE'S STARTING TO FUCKING LOVE IT -- PILO SOMETHING THIS FAST FEELS GOOD. He reaches for a CONVERTIBLE ROOF latch -- then the other with the speed he's driving, THE ROOF RIPS RIGHT OFF THE CAR -- Jim glances back, wide-eyed -- and the roof TUMBLE through the air, landing on the road -- and we PUSH AND A AROUND, as a POLICE OFFICER runs out from taking a roadsi -- he races back, jumps on his HOVERCRUISER and TAKES OFF

dialogues.speaker: SPEEDING AFTER HIM, SIREN BLARING
dialogues.text: BACK IN THE CORVETTE -- BLOOPBLOOP!!! -- Jim's eyes dart REARVIEW as the cruiser WEAVES behind him -- then PULLS U BESIDE HIM -- the COP sees a CHILD driving and is AMAZED calls through his PA:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, you pull over that car! But Jim just BLASTS the RADIO LOUDER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, bag over shoulder, thumb out. He turns at the SOU the SIREN -- sees what's approaching... that car... looks familiar... and the THE CORVETTE SHOOTS PAST HIM, JIM AT WHEEL -- then the POLICE HOVERCRUISER! George runs into t middle of the road, mouth agape --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no... way. Back at the Corvette, Jim YANKS the steering wheel TOWARD COP -- who RISES to avoid the Corvette, which SCREECHES o perpendicular DIRT ROAD, kicking up wild dust as the Cop QUICKLY to follow --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jim is now officially LOVING THIS -- and he DRIVES THROUG FENCE -- CRASH! The Cop RACES through it, in the Corvette DUST -- and we PUSH IN on a SIGN that reads "DANGER - QUA AHEAD -- IOWA MINING CO." In fact --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the MASSIVE QUARRY -- hundreds of feet deep -- and UP to the Corvette and Cop speeding toward it --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: KIRK, EYES INTENSE, ALMOST SUICIDAL -- this is where he's headed all along -- and for a moment we think holy shit - is how James Kirk dies. He speeds toward the edge -- CLOS CLOSER -- but at the last second, Kirk SLAMS the brake -- car SKIDS -- PIVOTS -- and he LEAPS FROM THE CAR, WHICH S SIDEWAYS OFF THE CLIFF EDGE -- FALLING... falling... the comes to QUICK a STOP in CLOUDS of DUST as the Corvette E

dialogues.speaker: ON THE QUARRY FLOOR --
dialogues.text: The angry Cop hops off his hovercruiser, hand on weapon, Kirk, out of breath, exhilarated, gets to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as he stands, we PUSH IN on him -- LOW and WIDE -- da that kid doesn't have a swagger. It's like the first time ever stood in his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Kirk. James Tiberius Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as our MUSIC BUILDS we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONSTANT SHOCKS OF LIGHT as an ALIEN PRISONER -- intellig pedal, but with FOUR TERRIFIED EYES -- is SLAMMED DOWN on wet pavement -- a CHOKE STICK SHOVED under his chin -- th VOICES. Brutal, guttural KLINGON --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) You say they are not yours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP PAN TO SEE the scary KLINGON GUARDS -- four of them standing above the Alien -- chilling MASKS hide their hid faces -- and one holds a FLUORESCENT SET OF PAGES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... these Federation maps we found in your pockets.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And the ALIEN SPEAKS -- an UNKNOWN LANGUAGE -- all eyes w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) I speak the truth. I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who are they for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Alien just SHAKES HIS HEAD, afraid -- he will not So they GRAB HIM AND YANK HIM UPWARD --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would rather die then tell us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN TIGHT as the Alien finally WHISPERS, terrified:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the Guards look at each other... seemingly with conce MOMENTS LATER EIGHT GUARDS WALK TOGETHER -- and we PAN WI to reveal the HORRIFYING EXPANSE THAT IS THE KLINGON PRIS YARD. We realize that the constant shocks of light was LIGHTNING, that apparently never stops here. A SUPER READ "RURA PENTHE - KLINGON PRISON ASTEROID". And we see they' heading for a MUSCULAR FIGURE, using a SLEDGE HAMMER, SPL ROCKS, lit brilliantly by the lightning strikes. BOOM UP find that it's NERO. And he stops, SENSING the coming Gua And he manages a small smile. And he QUICKLY TURNS to the THEY ALL STOP, SUDDENLY. Afraid of him. One of them tosse Nero a set of MANACLES. Nero picks them up. Puts them on. offers his cuffed hands, willingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards drag Nero through the massive pyramidal structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nero's ARMS AND LEGS get STRAPPED IN TIGHT. Go WIDE to re he's pinned to an interrogation table -- three GUARDS. A KLINGON INTERROGATOR approaches; looms over Nero, studyin Romulan's face with clinical detachment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED KLINGON) I have come far to meet you. "The One Who Does Not Speak." Ten years is a long time to maintain silence. (beat) Perhaps you simply do not speak Klingon, just as I do not speak Romulan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ENGLISH now) But I assume we both speak the language of our common enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED.) He reveals a worn LEATHER JOURNA Opens it, flips through it almost casually... we see SKET the JELLYFISH SHIP, PAGES OF COMPLICATED MATH EQUATIONS..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found this book in your cell. Cartography, mathematics-- what do these mean? This date here -- eleven years from now-- what happens then? (holds up the FLUORESCENT MAPS) And why attempt to smuggle in maps of Federation space?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nero's face betrays nothing; no fear, no doubt. Cold as f ice.   The Interrogator happens to stare at a page in the A DRAWING OF SPOCK. He closes the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were captured we assumed you were a spy, sent from Romulus to surveil the Empire. But because the Romulans deny your existence, I believe you are much more than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interrogator looks over to the Guards, nods. A Guard appr with some kind of GLASS CONTAINER; we HEAR something wet FLOPPING around inside, but we can't SEE what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ship remains in orbit above us now. We've been asking for its secrets for too long. That is why I am here. We want to know how it works and I believe now, finally... you will tell us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Guard uses TONGS to pull out the most DISGUSTING creatu you've seen from the container: a SLUG with SUCKERS and s covered in a grimy muck -- it FLIP FLOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Centaurian slugs. Their native planet is in constant sunlight. As a result, there's nothing they hate more... than darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Guard GRABS NERO'S HEAD and FORCES IT BACK; the second HIS MOUTH OPEN with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: 54B CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Another Guard SHOVES THE THING INTO NERO'S MOUTH -- Nero his eyes open -- furiously determined not to be broken -- they FORCE HIM TO SWALLOW IT -- he DOESN'T SCREAM as the wretched thing makes its way down his esophagus and into stomach --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They try to claw and bite their way out of any dark space they're in. Nero stares at the ceiling in HORRIFYING INTERNAL PAIN -- straining to block it out. PUSH DOWN on Nero's wide, craz eyes -- TIGHTER as we SLOWLY DISSOLVE TO SEE WHAT HE'S SE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. A waiting area. AMANDA, Spock's mother, stands alo a passageway. She looks off-camera to her son:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, come here, let me see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock. Reluctantly, Spock walks into frame. She begins adjusting collar. This is our ADULT SPOCK. Gripped by anxiety but t like hell to look impassive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no need to be so anxious. You'll do fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am hardly "anxious", mother. (beat, then, anxiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And "fine" has variable definitions. "Fine" is unacceptable. She just smiles as she works his collar. He sees this and annoys him. He tries to move her hands away, to stop with collar -- his annoyance, her love for him, all sweet-- bu doesn't let go of her hands. A meaningful silence between

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask a personal query?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I choose to complete the Vulcan discipline of Kolinahr... and purge all emotion... I trust you will not feel it reflects judgement upon you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him, moved.      Touches his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As always... whoever you choose to be... you will have a proud mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD on mother and son, worlds apart but forever bonded:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An imposing yet BEAUTIFUL INDOOR ATRIUM. Spock stands bef the VULCAN HIGH COUNCIL. Among faces on the dais: his FAT seated beside the SCIENCE MINISTER and other VULCAN LEADE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have surpassed the expectations of your instructors. Your final record is flawless. With one exception. I see you have applied to Starfleet as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was logical to cultivate multiple options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logical but unnecessary. You are hereby accepted to the Vulcan Science Academy. A distinction all the more significant given that you will be its first half- human pupil. It is truly remarkable, Spock. That you have achieved so much despite your disadvantage. Welcome to the Academy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all start to rise.      But Spock is suddenly unsett

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you would clarify, Minister-- what "disadvantage" are you referring to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... your human mother.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As the council disperses, we PUSH IN on Spock's face -- t look he had when he took punches as a kid. He glances at father to say something, but Sarek's the consummate diplo His eyes command: remain calm. Spock STRUGGLES... then ma the first spontaneous -- human -- decision of his life --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Council -- ministers.    I must decline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone STOPS.   A solid BEAT.   Confused looks turn col

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Vulcan has ever declined admission to this academy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then as I am half-human, your record remains untarnished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock. You have made a commitment to honor the Vulcan       At the moment, Fathe way--                                think of no greater

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you come before this council today? Was it to satisfy your emotional need to rebel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came with the intention of enrolling, as my father wished. However, your "insight" has convinced me otherwise. Therefore, the only emotion I wish to convey is gratitude. Thank you, Ministers, for your consideration. (a contained "fuck you") Live long and prosper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to his father, whose disappointment is evident - still, God bless him, Spock walks out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- PUSH DOWN A HALLWAY -- MUSIC HEARD -- what seems like is going on through windows in the double-doors ahead -- WOMAN SWOOPS INTO VIEW in front of us -- we PUSH BEHIND H the short skirt and high boots as she ENTERS the place -- local, busy BAR -- the woman makes her way to the BAR, an see her GORGEOUS, DIGNIFIED FACE. THIS IS UHURA. She lean into the bartender warmly, her smile glorious:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'd like a Klabnian Fire Tea, two Cardassian Sunrises and three Earth beers, no slim-shots, anything on draft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lot of drinks for one woman. Wearing those boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES KIRK'S FACE leans in: at 22, he's charming, witty, dangerous, rebellious. He grins at her, flirty. Uhura giv him a look, then back to the bartender:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a shot of Jack, straight up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) Make it two -- her shot's on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her shot's on her. Thanks but no thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want my name before you completely reject me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good without it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, he likes her already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are good without it. It's Jim. Jim Kirk. (long beat) If you don't tell me your name, I'm gonna have to make one up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Uhura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura? No way -- that's the name I was gonna make up for you. Uhura what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just Uhura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't have last names in your world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura is my last name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't have first names in your world? Wait, let me guess. Is it "Jim"? That makes her smile.    So he moves closer to her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so you're a cadet. Studying. What's your focus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Xenolinguistics. Lemme guess: you don't know what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess: study of Alien languages: phonology, morphology, syntax-- it means you've got a talented tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for a moment I thought you were just a dumb hick who only has sex with farm animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.    Not only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, baby, I'm the smartest. Something sad in that.    A BURLY STARFLEET CADET appears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy bothering you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond belief, but nothing I can't handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could handle me.    That's an invitation. The Burly Cadet spins Kirk around:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.    You mind your manners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At ease, Cup Cake, it was a joke.     Like your hairline. Uhura turns back.    The other cadets, seeing trouble, ap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- Jim: enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me, Moon Beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to count farm boy?    There's five of us... and one of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so go get some more guys, come back and it'll be an even fight. The cadet swings his fist but Kirk HEADBUTTS HIS HAND, BR IT -- another Cadet PUNCHES KIRK, then THROWS HIM into a which Kirk FLIES OVER, landing hard -- another Cadet GRAB pulls him up -- Kirk SLAMS FIVE FAST PUNCHES that send th back -- when ANOTHER CADET PUNCHES HIM -- yet another HOL -- and that last punch is repeated THREE-- then FOUR time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough!    STOP! Another punch and Kirk FLIES TO THE FLOOR - he's out of i won't give up. The Cadets UNLEASH on him and really PUMME - and Kirk's spirited, but LOSING -- about to LOSE BAD -- an EAR-SPLITTING WHISTLE makes everything STOP -- they tu standing in the doorway is a tall, rugged Starfleet offic CAPTAIN CHRISTOPHER PIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, all of you!       NOW! The cadets file out, in for it. Pike moves to a dazed, se conscious Kirk, now upside down on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'alright, Son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can... whistle really loud, y'know that? -- and Kirk PASSES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH WIDE OVERHEAD SHOT of the almost-closed bar. Only Ki Pike sit here at a table. Kirk's bloodied, tissue in his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't believe when the bartender told me who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and who am I, Captain Pike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father's son. (then, smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For my dissertation, I was assigned the U.S.S. Kelvin. Something I admired about your dad... he didn't believe in no-win scenarios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sure learned his lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on how you define winning. You're here, aren't you? (off Kirk's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That instinct to leap without looking-- that was his nature, too. And in my opinion it's something Starfleet has lost. We're admirable, respectable. But overly-disciplined. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those cadets you took on, they'll make competent officers -- but you can bet your ass they'll run home to momma the minute they're looking down the barrel of a Klingon phaser cannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- why are you talking to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked up your file while you were drooling on the floor. Your aptitude tests were off the charts-- what is it, d'you like being the only Genius Level repeat-offender in the midwest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So your daddy dies... you can settle for a less-than-ordinary life. (beat) Or do you feel like you're meant for something better? Something special?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that just hangs there for a beat. Because Pike just h nerve. Kirk does his best not to show it -- still absent- mindedly fiddling with STARFLEET SHIP SALT AND PEPPER SHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to think of it, I do want to feel special. You know what? I'm gonna go start a book club--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enlist in Starfleet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enlist. You must be way down on your recruiting quota for the month--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're half the man your father was, Jim, Starfleet could use you. You could be an officer in four years, have your own ship in eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's getting under Kirk's skin -- but Kirk keeps up the ' grabs his jacket, stands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're even, right?   I can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riverside shipyard. Shuttle for new recruits leaves tomorrow, 0800. (Kirk turns, Pike grabs him) Your father was Captain of a Starship. For twelve minutes. I dare you to do better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes lock... and it's now Pike who stands and walks off. that's where it hangs. Off Kirk, brooding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORN STALKS whipping by -- Kirk on his SPOKELESS MOTORCYC rocketing across the plains -- his soul's been stirred an fighting it -- he cranks it, ELECTRIC ENGINE SCREAMING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk pulls up to us, kills the bike. Camera starts to MOV AROUND HIM -- he's dramatically BACKLIT and we COME AROUN an INCREDIBLE REVEAL of a SHIPYARD -- at its center, the skeletal frame of a NEW SHIP under arclights. UNMISTAKABL U.S.S. ENTERPRISE. Unformed, raw, like its future captain MUSIC SWELLS, we PUSH IN ON HIM, considering Pike's offer future, his fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shipyard is abuzz with activity -- cadets loading int shuttle -- and Pike, staring off, waiting. The PILOT approaches:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for something, Cap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No.   Guess not. He climbs in. The pilot rapidly flips through switches, r a pre-flight sequence. Pike straps in. Glances through th viewshield... SEES SOMETHING... and he smiles. From his P KIRK on his MOTORCYCLE, driving into the shipyard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold her a second... Kirk rides past a WATERFALL of cooling tanks -- stops the near the shuttle -- steps off, has nothing -- no bags -- the clothes on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice ride, man. Kirk kicks the stand, tosses the guy the startcard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live it up. Kirk walks past the startled worker and approaches Pike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four years?   I'm gonna do it in three. Pike grins as Kirk passes him. Inside the shuttle, Kirk moves down rows of new recruits, of them ALIEN. Passes UHURA and the BARFIGHT CADETS, who UP when they see him -- one has a BANDAGED HAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At ease, Gentlemen. (then, to Uhura) Never did get that first name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't help it: a grin) And you never will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles as he takes a seat at the back of the shuttle. in as it RISES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you people deaf? I told you I don't need a doctor, damnit! I AM A DOCTOR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk turns to see a MAN being forced OUT of the BATHROOM FEMALE FLIGHT OFFICER -- at 34, he has a Southern lilt an like a prisoner waiting for the guillotine to fall:

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT OFFICER MAN
dialogues.text: -- you need to find a seat --     -- I had one, in the ba Darlin', with no windows --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sir, for your own safety,      -- I suffer from Aviaph siddown, or I will MAKE you       case you don't understa sit down... do you hear me?       words, it means 'fear o RIGHT NOW.                        in something that flies They GLARE at each other, then the man drops into the sea beside Kirk. The ship TORQUES to one side and the man GRI armrests, pale, sweating -- glances at Kirk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might throw up on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think these things're pretty safe--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pander to me, kid: one tiny crack in the hull and our blood boils in thirteen seconds -- solar flare might crop up, cook us in our seats -- Hell, some of the damn passengers are blue. And wait'll you're sitting pretty with a case of Andorian shingles, see if you're still so relaxed when your eyeballs are bleeding-- space is disease and danger, wrapped in darkness and silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to break this to you, but Starfleet operates in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well my ex-wife took the whole damn planet in the divorce, I got nowhere to go but up. Leonard McCoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim Kirk-- you really gonna throw up--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe-- As the TREK THEME SOARS, the shuttle ascends and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nero lies on the floor of his cell, semi-conscious, looki death. Behind him the DOOR OPENS. Two KLINGON GUARDS ente backlit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day you've been waiting for is upon us, Silent One. And look. No sign of salvation. No sign of change. Just more pain. And they both lift his limp body up -- as something mirac happens -- NERO SNAPS TO LIFE AND SINGLE-HANDEDLY BEATS T

dialogues.speaker: OUT OF THE GUARDS
dialogues.text: what seems like an instant, he's the only one standing he holding both of the Guards' rifles -- which he TWIRLS, ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON THE DOOR as it opens -- Ayel, chained, looks u intensely -- and sees that it's NERO who has arrived -- w IN TIGHT ON HIM as he SPEAKS FOR THE FIRST TIME:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wait is over. Off Ayel, we CUT TO: 64H   EXT. STARFLEET ACADEMY GROUNDS - DAY   [FORMER SC. TILT DOWN from a GLIMMERING BUILDING TO REVEAL a sea of R CADET UNIFORMS: HUNDREDS OF CADETS head across campus, Mc Kirk among them. A miraculous view of San Francisco benea blue sky, Golden Gate Bridge piercing the air. Kirk strut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you'll do it for me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask if you have interest, I asked if you'd do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm about to ask you an obvious question: why bother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I've failed the test twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're determined to make it three. We've all failed it-- everyone has, and that's the point! No one goes back for seconds, let alone thirds -- it's not like you need to pass it to graduate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Bones: why do they make us take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to stop calling me that. You're very annoying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're the greatest -- thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better study for it this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no-- Bones -- I gotta date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A date? Listen, as smart as you are, which ain't much, if you don't prepare--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea how prepared I'm gonna be-- no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with a smile, Kirk heads off -- McCoy watches him go, calling after him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, stop calling me Bones! (to himself, hating it) "Bones".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In MOONLIGHT, a beautiful WOMAN lies on her back, in some of bra, moaning in delight -- this is GAILA --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- oh Jim... Jim... Jim, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing her) ... Yeah. I sent you a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaila reaches over, turns on the light and we realize: SH GREEN. And not particularly happy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say "I love you", and you say "I sent you a message?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but you can only open it tomorrow at three o'clock on the dot --                        -- what are you talking What is it? What does it say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Gaila, promise me you're not going to open it 'till        -- what is it?    Tell three --                          it says! -- I'll erase it, I swear, if you don't promise me you'll       -- All right!!    Three wait --                           I prom-- They're INTERRUPTED by a DOOR OPENING -- GASP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) You can't get caught in this dorm-- hide! Under the bed, quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk falls, lands hard on the floor, SCRAMBLES under the Gaila's roommate enters -- UHURA. Dropping her backpack:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey-- I thought you were going to be in the long-range sensor lab all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was supposed to be, but it was crazy, I picked up an emergency transmission from a Klingon prison planet -- there was an escape and a ship stolen from th-- (suddenly senses) ... you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, been running simulations all week, just catching up on some rest. Tired. (fake yawn) That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura watches her.   Her eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you running simulations with the mouth-breather hiding under the bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaila freezes, caught.   Uhura looks down, Kirk PEERS OUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hearing is scary-- you sure both your parents are human?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell are you doing with him in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it! I love him!      Gaila loves me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here -- it's my ass too if administration catches you in this dorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting dressed, to Uhura) You and I have a big day tomorrow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing him out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I pass, will you tell me your first name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet, tries to charm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the fact that you picked up a transmission of a Klingon prison escape is very interesting. SHE CLOSES THE DOOR ON HIM and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Narada APPEARS through space --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead silence on the bridge... all eyes on the VIEWSCREENS starfield, roiling clouds of methane ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have arrived at the coordinates you requested. Stardate confirmed. 2258.5. Nero stands, looks out through his view screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standby. Ayel studies his console, hope in his eyes.     Quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain... long range scans of Beta Quadrant complete. Romulus is there. She's there. We could go. Right now, go home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet -- not like this. Not how we left. This is our chance... to serve our people. We owe it to them -- to do what no other Romulan could ever do.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ayel hides his disappointment behind his eyes as suddenly LIGHTNING STORM -- impossibly, from nowhere -- LOTS OF IT through the lightning erupts THE JELLYFISH -- THE SHIP NE BEEN LOOKING FOR DECADES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back.    Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we won't know where we are as MUSIC BUILDS and we CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura TURNS TO US, at her comm station -- PUSH IN on her. seems wildly BORED and almost RESENTFUL:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we are receiving a distress signal from the U.S.S. Kobayashi Maru. The ship has lost power and is stranded. Starfleet Command has ordered us to rescue them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP TO THE COMMAND CHAIR, where KIRK captains the batter bridge. Confident -- cocky:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Starfleet Command has ordered us to rescue them... Captain."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glares, turns away.      Then McCoy, at a console, re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klingon vessels have entered the Neutral Zone. And they are firing upon us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCoy and Uhura -- and the others -- look at him, confuse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCoy and Uhura share a look -- that's when we CUT TO: 81B   INT. TESTING CONTROL BOOTH - CONTINUOUS [FORMER SC. Looking at the bridge from above, we PULL BACK to reveal observation room above the faux-ship. This is the test Ki referring to. CONSOLE TECHNICIANS monitor the proceedings TEST ADMINISTRATOR turns to another and asks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say "don't worry about it"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we CONTINUE TO PULL BACK TO REVEAL that, sitting amon technicians, is Gaila. Our resident GREEN GIRL. She check watch -- PUSH IN ON IT: 2:59 PM. On her MONITOR awaits a century e-mail -- a MESSAGE FROM KIRK --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three more Klingon Warbirds decloaking -- and targeting our ship -- I don't suppose this is a problem either?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're firing, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alert medical bay to prepare to receive all crew members from the damaged ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how do you expect us to rescue them when we're surrounded by Klingons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alert medical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annoyed, she does as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our ship is being hit -- shields at sixty percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we at least, I dunno, fire back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm... no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON GAILA'S WATCH as it changes to 3:00 -- and she Jim's message -- and all it reads is, "I'M SORRY." And then something UPLOADS and EXECUTES and ALL THE SCREENS AND ON THE BRIDGE DIE -- THE SYSTEM CRASHES -- everyone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the hell's happening?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew doesn't know what's up -- except Kirk, who is remarkably pleased -- when the LIGHTS AND MONITORS COME B things are not the same:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perplexed, works controls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the Kobayashi Maru is still in distress... but... the Klingons have stopped firing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arm photons. Prepare to fire on the Klingon warbirds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, their shields are up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they? McCoy looks at his monitor.   No they're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire on all enemy ships -- one photon each should do -- let's not waste ammunition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Target lock acquired on all warbirds -- firing! They fire -- AND DESTROY ALL FIVE KLINGON SHIPS INSTANTLY mouths here are agape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begin rescue of the stranded crew. So. We've eliminated all enemy ships, no one on board was injured and the successful rescue of the Kobayashi Maru crew is underway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time, Kirk looks up to the testing room win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're stunned up here, too -- Test Administrator #2 to someone OFF-CAMERA:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell'd that kid beat your test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL who he was talking to: SPOCK is here.      And not

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I do not know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON a stern STARFLEET ACADEMY PRESIDENT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James T. Kirk.     Step forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a huge Starfleet chamber. Golden Gate Bridge visible through huge windows. 500 cadets, a nervous KIRK among th He stands, moves to one of two PODIUMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An incident has occurred today that concerns the entire student body. Academic immorality by one is an assault on us all. It will. Not. Stand. Cadet Kirk, evidence has been submitted to this council suggesting you violated the ethical code of conduct pursuant to regulation 17.43 of the Starfleet code. Is there anything you care to say before we begin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable beat) Yessir. I believe I have the right to face my accuser directly.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: President nods toward the assembly. SPOCK RISES. He and K MEET EYES for the first time. It's clock-stopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step forward please. This is Commander Spock, one of our most distinguished graduates. He's programmed the Kobayashi Maru test for the last four years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock steps up to the OTHER PODIUM.      President nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cadet Kirk. It is obvious you somehow managed to install and activate a sub- routine in the programming code, thereby changing the conditions of the test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We happen to find GAILA, in the crowd, fucking pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your point being?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In academic vernacular, you cheated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Respectfully.    Define "cheating".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To deceive by trickery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let me ask you something I think we all know the answer to: the test is rigged, isn't it? You programmed it to be unwinnable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kirk, I don't see how the intent of the exam is relevant to these proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if I'm right, Sir, then the test itself is a cheat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your argument precludes the possibility of a no-win scenario --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe in no-win scenarios --

dialogues.text: Full reverse, come about Starboard ninety degrees! Drop us down underneath them! Prepare to fire all weapons!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Narada FIRES A TORPEDO and in a wild move, the Enterp DROPS AND TUMBLES -- the SEPARATING TORPEDO passes RIGHT THE ENTERPRISE'S NACELLES -- ONE PIECE HITS our hero ship DEFLECTOR DISH -- another the MAIN DISH and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CREW MEMBER runs through the machine room catwalks as a EXPLOSION sends him -- and large steel tanks -- TUMBLING

dialogues.speaker: SPACE --
dialogues.text: We see the ship from a distance -- the scale of the destr relatively small --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shields at thirty-two percent! Their weapons are powerful, Sir, we can't take another hit like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me Starfleet Command!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, the Romulan ship has lowered some kind of high energy pulse device into the Vulcan atmosphere-- its signal appears to be blocking our communications and transporter abilities!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All power to forward shields -- prepare to fire all weapons!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photons LOADED fast by CREW MEMBERS and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise SWOOPS AROUND, firing photons at the Narad takes the hits in stride --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge in action --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire torpedoes, take them out--! And just before our heroes are blown into oblivion, Nero suddenly LURCHES FORWARD and stabs out a hand:

dialogues.speaker: WAIT
dialogues.text: Nero's eyes are hard and bright as diamond drills:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hull -- magnify -- On screen, the Enterprise's hull is revealed "U.S.S. ENTE NCC-1701." Nero LIGHTS UP with recognition --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike on the comm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divert auxiliary power from port nacelle to the shields--! But Pike stops when he sees, on the viewscreen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, we're being hailed! Pike looks over -- nods -- Uhura works controls and on viewscreen, Nero appears. Cool. Cordial. In English:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Captain Christopher Pike, to whom am I speaking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am called Nero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON KIRK -- breathless -- suddenly staring at the ma murdered his father -- holy SHIT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've declared war against the Federation. Withdraw, and I'll agree to arrange a conference with Romulan leadership at a neutral loca--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not speak for the Empire. We stand apart. As does your Vulcan crew member... isn't that right? Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes on Spock.   Spock looks to Pike, who nods permis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nero) Pardon me. But I don't believe you and I are acquainted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... no, we're not. Not yet. (then) I would like you to see something. Spock. (then) Captain Pike-- your transporter capability is disabled. You will man a shuttle and come aboard the Narada for negotiations. That is all.
