dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transmission ENDS.   The crew stares in grave anticip

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- he'll kill you, you know that--                               Your survival is unl -- Captain, we gain nothing by diplomacy-- going over to that       -- I, too, suggest y ship is a mistake.                   this strategy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that -- (loud, to the bridge) I need officers who have been trained in advanced hand-to-hand combat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu's hand goes up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have training, Sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then come with me -- Kirk, you too-- you're not supposed to be here anyway. (to Chekov)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radio the engine room, have Chief Engineer Olsen meet us at Shuttle Bay Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, Keptin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Bridge doors WHOOSH open -- they EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE TRACK FAST with Pike, Kirk, Spock and Sulu as they HUR through the Enterprise toward the shuttle bay:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without transporters, we can't beam off the ship, can't assist Vulcan, can't do our job. I'm creating an opportunity: Mr. Kirk, Mr. Sulu and Mr. Olson will space-jump from the shuttle. You'll have chutes -- you'll land on that machine they've lowered into the atmosphere that's scrambling our gear-- you'll get inside, disable that thing then beam back to the ship. Kirk and Sulu share a HOLY FUCKING SHIT look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Spock, I'm leaving you in command of the ship. Once we have transport capability and communications back up, you'll contact Starfleet and report what the hell's happening here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something you've got only precious few minutes to figure out. If all else fails, fall back and rendezvous with the fleet in the Laurentian System. (Spock is freaked, then) Kirk. I'm promoting you to First Officer. KIRK                               SPOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?!                           -- Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I'm gone we need to keep the chain of command. And you two make a swell team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain. Please. I apologize, but the complexities of human pranks escape me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a prank, Spock.   And I'm not the Captain. You are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, he's DONE. Strides off.     Kirk finally s the shock of his PROMOTION --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once we knock out that machine... Sir, what happens to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you'll have to come get me. (turns; to Spock) Careful with the ship. She's brand new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They appreciate the pure BALLS of that. BRAVERY washes ov them -- they'd fucking DIE for their Captain, who now tur Kirk and Sulu --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit up, Gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarek's hovercraft speeds along the desert floor, arrivin massive CAVE OPENING -- he and Amanda hurry off the craft into the cave --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge doors WHOOSH open -- all eyes on Spock as he enter their new captain. With cold certainty, he takes the comm chair, hits the intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Puri, report --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAOS, UTTER AND COMPLETE. WOUNDED MEN AND WOMEN, it's ba bloody -- a HAND hits an intercom: McCoy, badly shaken --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's McCoy-- Dr. Puri was on Deck 6, he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you have just inherited his responsibility as Chief Medical Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS: Kirk, Sulu, and the ship's LEAD ENGINEER OLSO suiting up for the drop, strapping on sleek AIRDROP ARMOR BELTS. CHUTE PACKS. HARNESSES. HELMETS. COM-SETS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race into the shuttle and take seats facing each oth across a narrow aisle -- Red Shirt Engineer GRINS like he going on a ski trip:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am pumped to kick some Romulan ass!   No joke. BRING IT ON! Kirk nods at him -- subtext: "What a fucking sack."     H Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what kinda combat training d'you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fencing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unimpressed, beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... fencing. In the COCKPIT, Pike works the controls -- MOTORS WHINE a craft LURCHES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the shuttle LEAVE THE DOCK --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttle soars from the Enterprise bay, the planet Vul red orb below... THRUSTERS FLARE as it descends and now w

dialogues.speaker: TETHERED
dialogues.text: The shuttle GLIDES to a hover, 60,000 FEET ABOVE THE DRIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KLAXON SOUNDS, signalling depressurization of the cargo the guys ready their equipment, snatching for handstraps, standing on the lip of THE AIRLOCK -- Kirk and Sulu meet through their helmet faceplates, the point of no return - PIKE'S VOICE over their headsets:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pre-jump on one: Three, two, one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck. Pike hits another control -- as the shuttle BOMB BAY DOOR - and KIRK, SULU, AND RED SHIRT ARE INSTANTLY PULLED OUT,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The falling trio TRACKED ON SCREEN, everyone watches, aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away team's entering the atmosphere -- SPOCK and UHURA meet eyes -- this is fucking insane -- an MAN'S ENTHUSIASTIC YELLING takes us to:

dialogues.speaker: TOWARD THE PLASMA DRILL
dialogues.text: -- their chutes SNAP OPEN -- JERKING THEM HARD UPWARD AS

dialogues.speaker: INSTANTLY EVISCERATED IN THE PLASMA LIGHT
dialogues.text: Kirk approaches -- more terrified than ever -- he comes i too -- SLAMS against the drill edge, bounces but quickly his footing -- hits a button on his chute and SLITS appea the fabric, suddenly there's no more drag and THE CHUTE A RETRACTS into Kirk's pack -- A REUSABLE PARACHUTE. BUT SULU ISN'T SO LUCKY: 20 yards from the drill surface chute gets SNARED IN THE CABLES, JERKING him upside down WIND is so intense Sulu is BLOWN SIDEWAYS -- his CHUTE LI begin RUBBING on the sharp metal of the suspension rig! K holds on to one of the chute's cables -- yells up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kirk tries to climb up, Sulu's cables begin to SNAP! O ONE -- and Sulu tries to CLIMB BACK using his chute cable toward the rig -- otherwise he's gonna fly off. As Kirk makes his way up the rig, suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk SPINS just as a Romulan appears -- tackling Kirk to drill platform! The two FIGHT PRECARIOUSLY ON THE EDGE OF SWIRLING PLASMA DRILL, WIND ROARING -- and suddenly there ANOTHER ROMULAN from an OPEN HATCH! SULU SLIDES DOWN THE - JUMPING and tackling the second guard and the shit is O Starfleet heroes battling these Romulans to the death -- Sulu KICKS OFF AN ANTENNA PIECE and uses it as a SABER -- fucking swashbuckling at 10,000 feet! It's a frenzied ass even the bigger Romulan isn't ready for, and Sulu manages KICK him into the vortex, where he's VAPORIZED as -- KIRK draws his PHASER and point-blank SHOOTS the Romulan, knocking him clear OFF the cylinder and into the sky, fal his death, DISINTEGRATING as he falls -- Against pummeling wind, Kirk and Sulu move toward the HAT OPEN IT -- as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike's SHUTTLE DOOR OPENS. Pike steps out. Surrounded by dozen of Nero's men. Ayel steps forward. Pike stands firm knowing this is the end for him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Captain Christopher Pi-- WHACK! He's cut off by a PUNCH to the face. Drops to his knees. Looks up at Ayel with blazing eyes, wipes a trickl blood from his lip:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for diplomacy. He's DRAGGED AWAY as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Sulu DROP IN through the outer hatch to find a c console, Sulu madly flips switches, no luck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of this is familiar-- the interface, the controls--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step back--                       -- what, you have an id -- yeahyeah, I do-- Kirk FIRES his PHASER at the console, BLASTING IT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The immense column of light DISAPPEARS, leaving only a to swirling vortex of DIRT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura's console LIGHTS UP with activity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jamming signal's gone -- communications are re-established --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transporter control re-engaged -- Spock looks up from his console, grave --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov, run gravitational sensors -- I want to know what they're doing to the planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, Commander-- Keptin, sorry.    Keptin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Romulan Helmsman RUNS to Nero --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drill's been sabotaged, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nero, mind racing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Launch the red matter. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POD we saw earlier is FIRED from the ship -- it WHIPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Sulu pull themselves from the control cockpit ba onto the drill's outer hull, they start to hear a SOUND..

dialogues.speaker: VULCAN'S SURFACE, DISAPPEARING INTO THE DRILLED GAPING HO
dialogues.text: And for an instant... nothing. What looks like a puff of billowing up from the planet's core... THEN A SHOCKWAVE B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk to Enterprise -- they just launched something toward the planet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keptin: gravitational sensors are off the scale -- if my calculations are correct, that pod they launched is creating a singularity... that will consume the planet.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK'S STOIC FACE. WE GET ONLY A HINT OF THE WILD EMOTIO
dialogues.text: STIRRING INSIDE HIM -- Uhura watches Spock, heartsick for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're creating a black hole... at the center of Vulcan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long does the planet have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... minutes, Sir. I'd say minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, to Uhura) Alert Vulcan Command Center to signal a planetwide evacuation-- all channels, all frequencies -- maintain standard orbit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Spock, wait --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes after him as he moves to the TURBOLIFT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To evacuate the Vulcan High Council-- they're tasked with protecting our cultural history. My parents will be among them--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you can't beam them out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not possible -- they'll be in the Katrik Arc, I must get them myself--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLOGRAMS of VULCAN UNDER DESTRUCTION -- Nero watching th pleased. He turns to Ayel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Retract the drill, let's move out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drill platform LURCHES -- begins RETRACTING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The platform BANKS -- Sulu FALLS BACK, OFF THE PLATFORM - WITHOUT A CHUTE! Kirk, holding on, watching this wide-eye and knowing what he must do, he RUNS AND JUMPS -- KIRK FALLS FAST, he's only gonna have one shot at this, p his arms to his sides and ROCKETS downward, building spee hundred feet below is Sulu, FREEFALLING -- KIRK moves his feet and hands, angling toward him -- slas downward at 160 mph, closing like a missile -- the gap be them narrows -- Sulu's 30 feet below him... 5000 feet to planet surface. 40 ft -- 20 -- 10 -- WHAM! Kirk slams int Sulu in a mid-air tackle -- they TUMBLE TOGETHER -- Kirk' the grab and locked his arms around Sulu in an iron grip, screams in his face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu DOES -- it opens -- but HOLY FUCK, the double weight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRANSPORTER CHIEF works his controls, sweating -- try

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying!   I can't lock on your signal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNAP AROUND as Chekov hears this -- watching his controls Uhura watching too --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you're moving too fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no-- I can do that-- I CAN DO THAT!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov suddenly BOLTS -- Uhura watches him race off -- a MEMBER steps into frame:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black hole's expanding, we won't reach minimum safe distance if we don't leave immediately!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov SPRINTS through CORRIDORS -- ENGINE ROOM -- YELLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we take him to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where he races to the controls, out of breath, yelling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and he begins working the controls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Sulu SPEED-DROPPING -- TERRIFIED --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov's manipulating a joystick-like TARGETING DISPLAY - trying to match the CROSSHAIRS on the DROPPING FIGURES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- holdonholdonholdonholdon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive SHEET OF LAVA, MILES HIGH, BURSTS INTO THE SKY and Sulu enter frame, BULLET-WHOOSH right past us, DROPPI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (headset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON CHEKOV as he struggles to lock onto them -- BEEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Compensating gravitational pull and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HITS A BUTTON and --

dialogues.speaker: AND REMATERIALIZE, SLAMMING DOWN ON THE TRANSPORTER PADS,
dialogues.text: AND PAINFUL, BUT SAFE! Transporter engineers GAPE in utte amazement and relief -- Chekov, sweating, laughs. Kirk an get their bearings, peeling themselves up, at stunned whi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... yeah, not a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kirk looks up as SPOCK hurries in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step aside -- I'm going to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the console ENGINEER works the display --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surface of what? YOU'RE GOING DOWN THERE? Are you nuts?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Energize --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Spock DEMATERIALIZES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN as Spock MATERIALIZES -- the distant landscape ar him COLLAPSING, IMPLODING, EXPLODING -- he sprints for th MOUNTAIN -- the entrance to the ARK -- a scared, small CR runs past Spock as he heads up the mountain -- rocks fall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock RACES through the tunnels as the world SHAKES aroun he enters the massive ARK CHAMBER -- sees, atop the enorm stairs, FIVE VULCAN ELDERS, Sarek among them, hands place the sarcophagus-like ark. Mind melding with it. Amanda is too, kneeling beside Sarek -- and she sees her son, who i RUNNING toward them -- she stands:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock--! Spock rushes up the stairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The planet's not safe, it has only seconds left -- we must evacuate now -- And as they run out, ENORMOUS ROCKS COLLAPSE AROUND THEM they run through the tunnels, the STONE COLLAPSING AROUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock and the group finally emerge from the tunnels to se THE PLANET IS COLLAPSING, COMING TOWARD THEM -- Spock whi open a tri-corder, TREMBLING LIKE CRAZY --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock to Enterprise: take us back now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov works the controls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locking volume, transport in 5-4-3--

dialogues.speaker: FACES
dialogues.text: TO DIE -- and Spock, trying to hold it together -- even t their transport hasn't yet begun -- looks at Amanda -- th eyes lock -- THE COLLAPSING GROUND RACING TOWARD THEM -- a surreal, intimate moment, Amanda says to Spock, quietly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.   To be scared.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON SPOCK, looking at her -- as the LIGHT DARTS st TRACING THEM -- and they begin to EVAPORATE AS THE GROUND FROM UNDER AMANDA -- AND SHE'S SUCKED DOWN -- AWAY -- as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov in a panic at the controls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as the Vulcans MATERIALIZE on the pad, Spock still REA for his mother -- but all he gets it the GHOSTLY IMAGE OF

dialogues.speaker: BY FOREVER
dialogues.text: as it lands -- Sarek too... a mother... a wife... has bee And Kirk stands nearby, having observed all of this, with anything to do or say... there's no cheating death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the Enterprise BLASTS AWAY -- in the distance, THE EN

dialogues.speaker: UNIMAGINABLE IMPLOSION
dialogues.text: And over this we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acting Captain's log. Stardate 2256.42: I have assumed command of the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOCK. The kind that crashes after the world's changed. I triage, the bay's filled with wounded Enterprise Officers Vulcan Elders and Sarek being examined as well. Kirk sits getting his hand bandaged from the fight. During this, he up, seeing one of the Elders being treated for a slight w her GREEN BLOOD seen through the bandage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've heard no word from Captain Pike. I have therefore classified him a hostage of the war criminal known as Nero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock sits in the captain's chair, reporting. He's glassy staring at nothing as he speaks. Behind him, Uhura sits, watching, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nero, who has destroyed my home planet. And most of its six billion inhabitants. I estimate no more than ten thousand survived. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the essence of our culture has been saved, in the elders who now reside upon this ship... I am now a member of an endangered species. Spock considers this. Clicks off the log recorder.     Sp off, into the turbolift -- Uhura follows him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock and Uhura. Silence hangs. She glances over, wanting say so much, but not to invade what must be the worst mom his life. He looks at her, with kind eyes. And Uhura does something odd -- she STOPS the lift. Spock looks over as wordlessly reaches out and puts her arms around him. Just holding him. Kissing his face with utter tenderness and comfort, which he lets her do... and we realize, this is intimacy before -- this is their secret...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. Spock looks off, taking comfort, bewildered and lost...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do?     Tell me what you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I need... He's on the verge of some emotional release... but self- consciousness returns and he clamps up, starting the lift

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need for us all to continue performing admirably. He looks at her again -- gives her another kiss. The door and he exits. She watches him go -- and the door closes o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk comes down the hall, stretching his hand bandage -- stops. Standing at the other end of the corridor, operati DATAPAD is a familiar-looking GREEN GIRL. Guilt overcomes After a beat he moves to her. Awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. (she turns to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, about what happened at Starfleet. The test and everything-- I know it looks like I was... using you, or whatever. And I'm sorry. I really am. And... I just hope you'll forgive me. She just stares at him for a long beat, as if she's just But Kirk's face changes... and then he says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you're not Gaila, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. And he walks off.   (NOTE: ALT. VERSION HAS GAILA SAYING,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura at her station, scanning for enemy signals -- all o principals are here, in debate:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, have you confirmed that Nero is headed for Earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their trajectory suggests no other destination, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earth may be his next stop, but we have to assume every Federation planet's a target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, agreed-- but why didn't they destroy us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why waste a weapon?      We weren't a threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not it.     He said he wanted me to see something.     The destruction of my home planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how the hell did they do that by the way? When did they jump so far ahead in the arms race?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engineering comprehension necessary to artificially create a black hole may suggest the answer: such technology could theoretically be manipulated to create a tunnel through space time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit, man, I'm a doctor, not a physicist -- are you suggesting they're from the future?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is what he's suggesting and I don't buy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you eliminate the impossible, whatever remains -- however improbable -- must be the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How poetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what would an angry future Romulan want with Captain Pike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Admiral he knows details of Starfleet's defenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we need to do is catch up to that ship. Disable it, take it over and get Pike back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all looking at Kirk like he's nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic, I'm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Pike left us with standing orders to rendezvous with the fleet on the other side of the quadrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're technologically outmatched in every way. A rescue attempt would be illogical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Illogical"-- you're funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention we couldn't do it anyway: Nero's ship would have to drop out of warp for us to overtake them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what about assigning Engineering crews to try and boost our warp yield?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remaining power and crew are being used to repair radiation leaks on the lower decks and damage to the main deflector shield-- without which we cannot communicate with          -- okay--okay, okayokayo Starfleet.                       there's gotta be SOME WA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must gather with the rest of Starfleet to balance the terms of our next engagement --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There won't be a next engagement, Spock: by the time we've "gathered", it'll be too late -- how many planets are you willing to risk? You say he's from the future? Knows what's gonna happen? Then the logical thing is to be unpredictable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're assuming Nero knows how events are predicted to unfold. The contrary: Nero's very presence has altered the flow of history, beginning with the attack on the U.S.S. Kelvin, culminating in the events of today -- thereby creating a new chain of incidents that cannot be anticipated by either party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone understand him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... an alternate reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely. Whatever lives we might have lived, if the time continuum was disrupted... our destinies have changed. (then:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu, plot a course for the Laurentian system, Warp Factor Three--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- wait-- don't do that -- Spock -- running back to the rest of the fleet for a confab is a massive waste of time--        -- These were the ord -- He also ordered us to go         Captain Pike issued w back and get him! Spock,            left ship-- you're Captain now--!               -- I am aware of my -- Every second we waste,           responsibilities, Mr. Nero's getting closer to his next target--!                      -- that is correct -- -- I will not allow us to go        that I alone am in co backwards, away from the problem, instead of hunting         -- then I must remove Nero down!                          this ship. If I confi For a beat, nobody moves -- an impossible choice for all them. Torn, Chekov and Sulu close in on Kirk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, don't worry ab -- -- but Kirk SWINGS, Sulu jerks, FASTER, spins, GRABS Kirk wrist! Kirk ELBOWS him as Chekov reaches for his PHASER b Kirk SLAMS HIM, the phaser DROPS -- Kirk reaches for it b Spock's fingers CLAMP on Kirk's neck: THE VULCAN PINCH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On PIKE'S FACE, strapped to a TABLE.    Nero looks down u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are only the second human I have ever met, face to face. You must have so many questions for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only have one for you. I need the subspace frequencies of Starfleet's border detection grids. Specifically those surrounding Earth. Pike looks up at him -- quiet rage.   Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christopher Pike -- Captain, U.S.S. Enterprise, registry NCC-1701.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christopher. (beat; hardcore)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer my question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You answer for the genocide you just committed on a peaceful planet--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I prevented genocide. (beat, calms)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where I come from, Christopher... this ship is just a mining vessel. I chose a life of honest labor to provide for myself... and the wife who was carrying my child. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sit here now... knowing you as enemies. Not just of today. But of tomorrow. I watched as your Federation did nothing. They let us burn to death... as our planet broke in half. Curiosity behind Pike's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Nero, you're confused. Romulus has not been destroyed. How can you blame the Federation for something that hasn't happened--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It did happen. I remember it. I... felt it. (then; pained)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I lost her... I promised myself I would not speak another word until the day of my retribution. In twenty five years I forgot the sound of my own voice... but I didn't forget the pain. That feeling cannot be erased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to anger now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A feeling that every surviving Vulcan now shares. Pike just looks at him.   Sees how fucking far GONE he is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If what you say is true... you can save Romulus. You have a second chance to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- yes, which is a gift I won't waste on mercy. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My purpose, Christopher, is not simply to avoid the destruction of the home I love... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but to create a Romulus which exists, free of the Federation. Only then will she be saved. And the "she" could refer to the planet... or to Nero's l love. Either way, Pike knows a losing battle when he's fi one. Ever so nobly, he quietly says --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we have nothing more to discuss. Nero reaches for something under the counter Pike lies up Retrieves A FAMILIAR GLASS CONTAINER -- inside -- DOZENS CENTAURIAN SLUGS, the very ones used on Nero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the fault of the human race that Starfleet chose Earth as its center. You're a more noble race than my fallen cousins. I'll take no pleasure in your extinction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How reassuring. Nero opens the container, reaches for a pair of TONGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frequencies, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christopher Pike -- Captain, U.S.S. Enterprise, registry NCC-1701. Nero sad-smiles.   What he expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish. A ROMULAN GUARD HOLDS PIKE'S MOUTH -- Nero uses the tongs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our POV is BLURRY. We come into FOCUS on a blinking instr panel. KIRK is stirring awake, his shoulder kills. He sit inside a ONE-MAN POD CRAFT. He WIPES THE GLASS -- looks u like a TUNNEL OF SNOW, 30 feet long, to the sky. THE PODC EMBEDDED ON THE SURFACE OF A VAST, ICE PLANET. Kirk's bee MAROONED. He closes his eyes, his face falls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer...    where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Current location Delta Vega: Class "M" Planet, unsafe. You have been ordered to remain in your pod until retrieved by Starfleet authorities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bite me, how's that. The CANOPY RISES -- a blast of cold air hits Kirk -- with agony, out he goes -- he CLIMBS UP THE TUBE OF SNOW -- an to the surface -- looks out. HE'S IN THE MIDDLE OF FUCKIN NOWHERE. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING along a massive ICE SHEET... Kirk ENTERS FRAME w along, cold, pissed... whips out a TRICORDER, speaks into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant's log, supplemental: I'm preparing a testimonial for my Starfleet court martial assuming there's still a Starfleet left. From overhead, what we see -- what Kirk doesn't -- is som HUGE, SLITHERING UNDERWATER beneath the ice --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acting Captain Spock -- whose only form of expression's apparently limited to his left damn eyebrow -- has marooned me on Delta Vega in what I believe to be a violation of security protocol 49.09, governing the treatment of prisoners aboard a st--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk FREEZES at a nearby GROWL. He looks -- sees nothing then ANOTHER GROWL -- he turns -- some thirty feet away, eleven foot-tall cross between a polar bear and a gorilla a POLARILLA) steps out from behind a mass of ice. Sees Ki It's horrifying. Kirk takes a SLOW, SMALL STEP BACKWARD - the fucking thing CHARGES HIM -- KIRK RUNS, TERRIFIED -- POLARILLA PURSUES -- gaining -- it's gonna EAT HIM ALIVE

dialogues.speaker: KIRK HAULS ASS AS THE THING COMES AFTER HIM
dialogues.text: FALLS -- DROPS -- and we see that Kirk is FALLING DOWN A SNOW MOUNTAIN! The huge red creature stops at the edge an ROARS LOUDLY -- until the ice shelf BREAKS AWAY! The crea starts to FALL AS WELL! Now Kirk is TUMBLING, the immense creature TUMBLING not far behind! And Kirk LANDS ON THE ICE, HARD -- sees a distant CAVE. L up at the FLAILING CREATURE that is about to CRUSH HIM -- tries to run, but the ice is TOO SLIPPERY -- FINALLY he g footing and runs off toward the cave -- as the red creatu LANDS HARD -- its sharp SPEAR LIMBS STAB into the ice as pursues Kirk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk races through the darkened cave -- the creature come after him -- Kirk goes as fast as he can -- the creature out and fucking GRABS HIM -- pulls him toward the disgust wet, TEETHY MOUTH -- Kirk tries to hold on to anything he but he's fucking LUNCH -- and just as you're SCREAMING, t LIGHT -- FIRE LIGHT -- and a FIGURE APPEARS, WAVING A TOR And the red creature's eyes ALL GO WILD -- and it DROPS K BACKS OFF, AFRAID -- the figure CHASES IT until it's gone Kirk, on the ground, is freaked out, out of breath, and c take his eyes off this man... who says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hen-Gra.   Notoriously afraid of heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the Figure turns... we may have recognized the voice. IT'S SPOCK. As in NIMOY. HERE. Lit in the darkness by the fire. We'll refer to him as SPOCK PRIME. He looks at Kirk moves closer to him -- finally seeing him. And is amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Jim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) -- how d'you know my name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you find me--? Does Starfleet know of my presence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock looks deep into the eyes of the freaked out young m feeling the full effect of fate playing its hand, but rea he doesn't recognize him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been... and always shall be... your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no, I don't know you -- the only Vulcan I know isn't exactly a buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of all the things Spock predicted Kirk might say, it wasn that. He's analyzing a thousand steps ahead, calculating:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are James T. Kirk. Your father is George, as is your brother. Your mother's name is Winona -- you were born in 2233 --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.   Please.     I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Spock nods, we PRE-LAP:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I am Spock. One hundred and thirty years senior to the Vulcan you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, beat, beat) Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firelight flickers -- shadows of Kirk and Spock Prime dan the ice walls. Remarkable NIGHT STARS outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's remarkably pleasing to see you again. (re: Vulcan) ... especially after the events of today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old friend. Sir, I don't have any idea how you know what you know. But I don't know you and if you are Spock we're not friends. You hate me. You marooned me here for mutiny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mutiny?   You are not the Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the captain.   Pike was taken hostage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing, grave) ... by Nero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guilty, burdened) ... he is a remarkably...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: troubled Romulan. (then) ... Please. Allow me -- it will be easier--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock Prime reaches for Kirk's face -- Kirk grabs his wri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A skeptical beat, but Kirk finally releases his hand. Spo gently places his fingers on Kirk's cheek and temple --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering; a mantra) Our minds... one and together...One hundred and twenty-seven years from now everything ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock's eyes SNAP SHUT, Kirk JOLTS as if by an electric c and the SCREEN OVEREXPOSES TO WHITE as we CUT TO our MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SUPERNOVA. An EXPLODING STAR, like a LIGHT, EATING AWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A star in Beta Quadrant will go supernova -- and like a cancer left untreated... it will grow... and destroy everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're seeing VULCAN SCIENCE ACADEMY -- where SIX VULC SCIENTISTS study a HOLOGRAM of this event -- the star's O its PATH OF DESTRUCTION -- and SPOCK PRIME is among them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the beginning of it myself. Vulcan Science Academy devised a plan to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN as the JELLYFISH SHIP is under construction --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We built a ship containing a material capable of generating the only thing powerful enough to consume a supernova. A black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're INSIDE the ship -- the CONTAINMENT HOLD -- bein ASSEMBLED by Vulcan Scientists --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agreed to pilot the ship. Knowing I would not return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 164   Now we see Spock Prime, in a ritual ceremony of a V Kamikaze pilot. Tea, sipped inside the Ark --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sacrifice, in service of all races, seemed only logical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Spock Prime sits in the Jellyfish COCKPIT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately... before I could begin the mission... the supernova destroyed Romulus.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: 166   -- and suddenly we're OUT OF THE MIND MELD as KIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nero's planet was destroyed--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He of course blamed us. Believed Vulcan allowed his planet to die. Which was hardly the case. Let me continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This annoys me, I don't like      -- I know, I know, I'm it-- do we have to do it like     surprised to hear you c this--?                           -- allow me to finish. Spock Prime touches Kirk again and we go:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the JELLYFISH SWOOPS PAST US -- and we PAN -- and see MASSIVE SUPERNOVA in the infinite distance -- no sense of here -- but then -- THE NARADA APPEARS -- FIRES TORPEDOES Jellyfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nero came after me. Determined to thwart my mission. If Romulus was allowed to die, he said... all planets should share its fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed an exit. I knew if this mission failed... everyone, everywhere... would lose everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock Prime LEAVES the cockpit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prime ENTERS AN AIRLOCK -- TUMBLES IN WEIGHTLESSNESS and THE CONTAINMENT ROOM. QUICK CUTS as he REMOVES RED MATTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realized: a large black hole could destroy the supernova. A smaller one... could be my escape. Could send me back in time, allowing me to complete my mission. So I created a black hole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock loads the CANNISTER with a small amount of RED MATT a JETTISON TUBE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and he FIRES THE CANNISTER INTO SPACE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock Prime back in the cockpit -- takes aim on his contr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK HOLE IS CREATED -- Spock Prime PILOTS TOWARD THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nero must have understood what I was trying to do. Because he began racing for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NARADA and the JELLYFISH aiming for the BLACK HOLE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock Prime watches as the NARADA GOES IN -- LIGHTNING ST STYLE DISAPPEARING FIRST -- then SPOCK PRIME'S FACE -- WH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nero simply got to it first. How long I was travelling... I couldn't tell you. It was timeless. But when I arrived...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHT on Spock Prime's face goes away -- he and the Jelly are back in SPACE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but now, facing him, is the NARADA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nero was waiting for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK INHALES, SHARPLY, having been there with Spock Prime to the two men, in a cave: Kirk stares at him... his mind spinning because now he believes him. The result is overwhelmingly emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me... emotional transference is an effect of the mind meld.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathy, surprise) ... so you do feel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Cthia" is the stricture that binds our emotions... but few of us are that perfectly Vulcan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk gathers himself, wipes his eyes on his sleeve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going back in time... you changed all our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet remarkably, events within our timelines, characteristics, people... seem to overlap significantly. Tell me about the rest of the crew? Chekov-- Uhura --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tactical and Communications --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sulu --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- he's the helmsman, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. McCoy would assert our meeting here is not a matter of coincidence... but rather, indication of a higher purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he'd call it a damn miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes he would. Perhaps the time stream's way of attempting to mend itself. In both our histories, the same crew found its way onto the same ship in a time of ultimate crisis -- therein lies our advantage. (rises) We must go-- there's a Starfleet outpost not far from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Kirk stands -- stops him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you came from... did I know my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... yes. You often spoke of him as your inspiration for joining starfleet. This is amazing for Kirk -- he looks off, trying to imagi life. Spock intuits what this means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should know. He proudly lived to see you become captain of the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ship we must return you to as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise STREAKS through frame in a warp blur --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu at his controls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp three. Course one-five-one mark three, the Laurentian System. The turbolift opens -- McCoy enters, moves to Spock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (discreet tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Doctor. I'm aware that James Kirk is a friend of yours. Supporting me, as you did, must have been difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... are you thanking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm simply acknowledging your difficulties. We're not sure how McCoy is taking this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission to speak freely, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I welcome it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you. Okay then: are you out of your Vulcan mind? Were you doing the logical thing? Maybe. The right one? Debatable. But one thing's for damn sure -- that kid doesn't know how to lose. Just isn't in his DNA. Back home we have a saying: "If you're gonna ride in the Kentucky Derby, don't leave your prize stallion in the stable."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a curious metaphor, Doctor. As a stallion must first be broken before it can reach its potential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, Man... you could at least act like it was a hard decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I intended to assist in the effort to re- establish communication with Starfleet. However, if crew morale would be better served by my roaming the halls weeping, I'll gladly defer to your medical expertise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strong look and Spock turns away as Sarek enters the br Spock moves to meet him. Off McCoy, fuming --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fucking BLIZZARD.   Kirk and Spock Prime move through t maddening whiteout.   Kirk yells through it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Spock POINTS -- an OUTPOST -- half a mile away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long tile corridor. The door at the end opens -- SNOW AND as Kirk and Spock Prime enter. Door closes. Silence again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... hello?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Echo. Nothing. They head down. After a beat, a SMALL, DAR ODDLY ALIEN CREATURE STEPS OUT. Eyes them curiously. This KEENSER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the station chief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenser looks them over.    Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... no.   This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they follow Keenser into a MASSIVE WAREHOUSE, filled with junked space parts. A large, tarped SHUTTLE in the background. In the middle of the huge, depressing space i table. And a STARFLEET OFFICER who is ASLEEP, legs kicked leaning back in a chair, a hat covering his face. Keenser the Officer's boot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat -- and the Officer peers from under his hat.     A slow burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize how unacceptable this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the Officer) ... Fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer stands, unhappy about something. Keeser watches n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it's no' your fault, and I know youse lads are just doing your jobs, but could you no' have come a wee bit sooner?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six months I've been living on nothing but Starfleet Protein Nibs and the promise of a real food delivery! Six months, boys! It's pretty clear what's going on here, isn't it? Punishment! Ongoing! For something that was clearly an accident!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Montgomery Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's me -- Scotty-- you're in the right place-- are there any other hard- working and equally-starving Starfleet officers around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You eat nothing. A bean and you're done for a week, I need food. And now you're here -- so. Thank you. Where is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are in fact the Mr. Scott who postulated the theory of trans-warp beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! That's exactly what I'm talking about! How d'ya think I ended up here? I got into a debate with my instructor on the issue of Relativistic Physics as they pertain to subspace travel... He seemed to think that the range of transporting say, a roast turkey, was limited to a few hundred miles -- so I told my instructor I could not only beam a bird from one planet to an adjacent planet in the same system -- which is no big deal anyway -- but if I were so inclined I could actually do it with a lifeform! So I tested it on Admiral Archer's prize beagle. Which... was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that dog. What happened to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell ya when it reappears.     Dunno. Feel guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I told you your trans-warp theory was correct? That it is indeed possible to beam onto a ship that is travelling at warp speed. And that you only required the correct field equation to recrystallize dilithium?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been stationed here that long. If such an equation had been discovered, I'da heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason you haven't heard of it, Mr. Scott... is because you haven't discovered it yet. Kirk reacts. Scotty reacts -- is almost spooked -- sobers bit... really regards Spock Prime. Skeptical. Amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'from the future, are ya? Brilliant. D'they still have sandwiches where you're from? Piece and jam? Mince 'n tatties? Cockaleekie soup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allow us access to your shuttle... and I will show you what a genius you actually are. Off Scotty, who can't help but be intrigued --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty PULLS A TARP over much of the out-of-service shutt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a wee bit dodgy: shield emitters are totally banjaxed, along wi' a few other things.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Spock finishes speed-typing the FIELD EQUATIONS on the TRANSPORTER CONTROL PANEL -- amazingly fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... rapid.   That's impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock Prime steps aside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your equation for achieving trans-warp beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty looks at the equations -- we watch his expression gamut: from confused, to dumbfounded, to quiet awe and de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine that! Never occurred to me to think of space as the part that's moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point of fact: it did occur to you. (he works the console) Extrapolating Enterprise's course --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Enterprise? Had its maiden voyage already, has it? Well, you must've done something right to be assigned to that ship, Kiddo. She's a well endowed lady -- love to get my hands on her ample nacelles, if you'll pardon the engineering parlance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's your chance, Mr. Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, even if I believed you -- where you're from, what I've done-- which I don't -- we're still talkin' bout slingshotting aboard while she's going faster than light. Without a proper receiving pad, that's like tryin'a hit a bullet with a smaller bullet, wearing a blindfold. On a horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I calculate no more than a four meter margin of error.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all well and good unless you rematerialize four meters outside the ship.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Spock works the keyboard, an ENTERPRISE SCHEMATIC rota

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agreed: the aft engineering bay is your best option: a large space and no unpredictable airlocks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you're coming with us, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jim. My destiny lies along a different path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your destiny can wait -- he         (simply, strong) won't believe me, only you can   Under no circumstances c explain w--                      be made aware of my exis You must promise me this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling me I can't tell you I'm following your own orders? Why not? What happens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. Above all. Jim, this is the one rule you cannot break. To stop Nero, you alone must take command of your ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How, over your dead body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preferably not. There is, however, Starfleet Regulation 619. (off Kirk's confusion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I forget what little regard you had for such things. 619 states that any commanding officer who is emotionally compromised by the mission at hand... must resign said command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I need to emotionally compromise you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim.  I just lost my planet. I can tell you.  I am emotionally compromised. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you must do... is get me to show it. PUSHING IN ON KIRK as this lands for him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, then. Live or die, Laddie, let's get this over with. he Enterprise has a decent cafeteria I'm guessing. Scotty's on the pad.   Kirk follows, looks at Spock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... coming back in time... changing history... that's cheating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trick I learned from an old friend. Something strikes Kirk -- his eyes GLINT with revelation. responds enigmatically: a silent acknowledgment of what K must do to get the ship. He raises his hand in the legend Vulcan salute:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live long, and prosper. And Spock activates the transporter and they DEMATERIALIZ the light plays off his face as he watches them vanish --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise SHOOTS THROUGH FRAME at warp --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid the ROAR of the ship's plasma drives, PARTICLES rematerialize... it's KIRK, eyes wide in suspense. He loo down at his legs, his chest, his arms to make sure he's s one piece, glances over to share his relief with Scotty.. SCOTTY ISN'T THERE. A strange BANGING -- Kirk turns: the BANGING is coming from a large metal TANK -- then Scotty in a TRANSLUCENT PIPE -- FREAKING OUT -- BANGING ON THE C METAL -- Kirk's mind races -- he looks around for a way t his new friend -- just then a STRONG CURRENT IS FELT insi tube -- AND SCOTTY IS YANKED AWAY, DOWN THE TUBE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no-- shit! And Kirk runs after him -- down the length of the ORANGE, TWISTING and TURNING tubes -- SCOTTY SEEN every time he e CLEAR TUBE AREA -- then DISAPPEARING again into the ORANG -- and Scotty gets sucked UPWARDS -- and Kirk turns and l

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWS THE LENGTH OF TUBE
dialogues.text: GIANT WATER TURBINE -- essentially? A MASSIVE FUCKING BLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no--nonono--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kirk HAULS ASS to the control panel -- we see the hug machine -- overhead, the RELEASE VALVE under the pipe -- Kirk works as fast as he can --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COMEONCOMEONCOMEON -- like the simulator: manual control enabled, pressure seal: enabled -- shutdown--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but the COMPUTER SAYS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turbine Shutdown Not Allowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A display on the forward console, an ALARM FLASHES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keptin, we're detecting unauthorized access to a water turbine control board!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock moves from Sarek to Chekov --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring up video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov brings up TWO DOZEN SECURITY VIDEO IMAGES ON ONE S Spock points to one -- it ENLARGES -- and we see KIRK AND racing through the ship -- Spock's eyes narrow -- he move the Captain's chair -- hits comm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security, this is the captain -- seal engineering deck and bring me the intruders in turbine station three -- set phasers to stun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE TUBE, SCOTTY TUMBLES, YELLING UNDERWATER as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, AT THE PANEL, accesses the RELEASE VALVE CONTROL -- watches Scotty disappear through a CLEAR SECTION -- Kirk it -- waiting -- then he HITS THE BUTTON and Scotty DROPS THROUGH THE RELEASE VALVE AND SLAMS TO THE FLOOR -- hurt, but BREATHING, deeply --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovering, looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- nice -- (cough) -- ship. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- let's get to the bridge--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and wet Scotty race through the ship -- only to fina turn a corner and be faced with PHASERS, AIMED RIGHT AT T But suddenly PHASERS are at their heads. Two SECURITY GUA one, THE GUY HE GOT INTO THE FIGHT WITH AT THE BAR, YEARS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.     Moon Beam. Off Kirk -- shit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOOSH -- bridge doors open -- Kirk and Scotty are ushered the Security Guards. Spock moves to them, containing his and dismay. McCoy is here as well. Spock walks right up t Kirk... raises his eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Scotty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're travelling at warp -- how did you manage to get aboard this ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk stares at the young Spock -- a different experience

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the genius, you figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Captain of this vessel I order you to answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm not telling. (then) Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUH.   That confounds Spock.   And Kirk is off to the rac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that frustrate you? My lack of cooperation... does it make you angry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock again focuses on Scotty --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not a member of this ship's crew. Under penalty of court martial, I order you to explain to me how you beamed ab --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Scotty) -- Don't answer him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will answer me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCOTTY.   Weighing all this.     Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather not take sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock nods back to the SECURITY GUARDS, over this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escort them to the Brig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before the guards can do so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it about you, Spock? Your planet was just destroyed -- your mother murdered -- and you're not even upset?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your presumption that these experiences interfere with my abilities to command this ship is inaccurate--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HA! And yet you said fear was necessary for command. I mean -- did you see that bastard's ship? Did you see what he did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tense)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you afraid or aren't you?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tenser)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not... allow you to lecture me about the merits of emotion. Kirk gets close to Spock --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why don't you stop me. Sarek watches, tense.   McCoy, too.   Spock blinks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step away from me, Mr. Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it like? Not to feel? Anger. Or heartbreak. Or the need to stop at nothing to avenge the death of the woman who gave birth to you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (volcanic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- back away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closer still)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must not feel anything! It must not even compute for you! You must not have loved her at all--! -- WHAM! SPOCK HAS JUST HIT KIRK -- and Kirk goes to hit but Spock fucking DELIVERS A SERIES OF POWERFUL BLOWS -- Security stand back as the Captain attacks... And Spock is now fucking CHOKING Kirk -- HE SLAMS KIRK AG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And everything -- everything -- STOPS. Spock, red-faced, releases his grip. Kirk GULPS air and tumbles to the grou Spock staggers back. Kirk's hardly able to speak, close t collapsing. But despite his brutalized face, his expressi isn't about spite, or hatred... but compassion. Spock sees the faces of the STUNNED CREW staring at him. worst of all? Sarek. His father. Spock levels his chin. Quickly wipes his eyes. Trying to regain some semblance o dignity... looks to McCoy. Softly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor. I am no longer fit for duty. I hereby relinquish my command on the grounds that I have been... emotionally compromised. Please note the time and date in the ship's log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESUS. Spock just... QUIT. And after a beat, he leaves th room. Sarek follows a moment later. The crew just stands there in stunned SILENCE.   Finally

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like this ship. It's exciting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCoy turns to Kirk, exasperated --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Jim. Now we've got no Captain and no first officer to goddamn replace him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON KIRK.   The moment is upon him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MCCOY. The CREW -- confused. Sulu just fucking POINTS Kirk and they all realize HOLY SHIT -- Pike made KIRK the Officer before he left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the support!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kirk moves to the captain's chair, passing Uhura:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure hope you know what you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... so do I. (studies chair, sits, into mic) Attention crew of the Enterprise.   This is James Kirk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING WITH SPOCK, hearing the announcement as he walks stoically -- past CREW, hearing this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Spock has resigned commission and advanced me to acting Captain. I know you were all expecting to regroup with the fleet, but I've ordered a pursuit course of the enemy ship to Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On KIRK as he ends the announcement:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want all departments at battle stations and ready in ten minutes. Either we're going down, or they are. Kirk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clicks off.    PUSH IN ON KIRK, staring off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want some answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up.    Uhura is there.   Pissed off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now. Where the hell'd you get trans-warp technology?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- yeah, you know that's complicated --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look simple to you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a PhD in astrophysics, I think I can handle it -- how'd you get back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You vant us to trust you but you von't tell us the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, I won't-- hey, I'm the Captain now! I don't have to tell you anything! Now listen: we need to figure out a way to catch up and get to Nero's ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not a chance. They're gonna be in geosynchronous orbit around Earth in ten minutes. We'll never make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if we could, you can't go in guns blazing, not with their technology, that's suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we find a way to get on that ship and steal the black hole device away from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you can forget transwarp. No way to predict the Narada's position from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura: anything from Captain Pike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I've been monitoring all channels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPOCK stand here, staring at the place where his mother s have, but didn't, arrive. Sarek enters. Sees his son. The alone for the first time in ages. A beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must not punish yourself. (beat) Speak your mind, Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be unwise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is necessary is always wise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch Spock's face.   Struggling with what's pent-up insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel as conflicted as I once was. As a child. Have I made so little progress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, softly) You will always be a child of two worlds. I am grateful for that. And for you. (painfully) And not only because you are all I have left of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock looks at Sarek.   This is as close to emotion as he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel anger. For the one who took her life. An anger I cannot stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe she would say... do not try to. (then) You asked me once. Why I married your mother. (beat, simply) I married her because I loved her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their look HOLDS -- and for Spock, a revelation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the strategy session continues in FULL SWING -- now Ch the youngest of the bunch, gets up the courage to chime i incidently becoming the very first officer to say:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keptin Kirk?    Excuse me, plees, could

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes shift to the wonder-kid who awaits permission to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Chekov-- you don't need to ask permission to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Based on the Narada's course from Vulcan, I've projected that Nero will travel past Saturn. If we could drop out of warp behind one of Saturn's moons, say, Titan, the magnetic distortion from the planet's rings will make us invisible to Nero's sensors. We could follow him to Earth by staying in his blind spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What blind spot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its exhaust wake. If we adjust our shield frequencies, they shouldn't detect us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute-- anyone understand this kid? How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am seventeen, Sir, how old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all old enough to shave here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor... Mr. Chekov is correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns, surprised: SPOCK has entered the bay -- galvanized, full of purpose --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have reviewed his telemetry. If Mr. Sulu can maneuver us into position, I can beam aboard Nero's ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't order you to do that, Mr. Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romulans and Vulcans share a common ancestry. Our cultural similarities will make it easier for me to access their ship's computer to locate the device. (beat; a flicker of emotion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, my mother was human. Which makes Earth the only home I have left.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The crew looks at this very courageous Vulcan with deep r - but his focus is on Uhura, whose eyes smile back at him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, considering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would cite regulation, but I know you will simply ignore it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, we're getting to know each other. And a MOMENT -- a burgeoning friendship --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANNING ACROSS AN ALIEN LANDSCAPE... and even though it's shadow, you start to recognize it as THE DARK SIDE OF THE OUR POV ascends now to see:

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTERPRISE DROPS OUT OF WARP IN THE DEAD SILENCE OF S
dialogues.text: And we move past it, along the orbit of the moon, crestin horizon to see EARTH -- AND NERO'S SHIP HOVERING ABOVE IT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON NERO -- his face illuminated on the DARKENED BRI the Narada by SOFT BLUE LIGHT. Light radiated by EARTH. A BEAUTIFUL HOLOGRAM before him. He doesn't notice behind h those BLADES from his STAFF APPEAR BEHIND HIS NECK. Nero tenses, only now sensing this unforeseen danger: AYEL HOL WEAPON. Strong. Tough. But under it all... terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men and I have discussed this. What we are about to do. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to turn the ship around. We can save our home. Nero turns slowly and deliberately -- Ayel tenses:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Nero now faces Ayel, blades at his throat -- Ayel growing nervous as he faces his master. The surrounding crew star frozen in the moment, only slightly confirming their make mutiny with scared looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can go back. That's what we want. We have taken our vengeance on Vulcan. No more. We want to go home now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nero considers this... nods gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no need, Ayel.   To threaten me. (beat) I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ayel is massively relieved.     Nero gently reaches out, staff (still aimed at him).     He deactivates it -- the instantly RETRACT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.    But you are wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just as Ayel realizes he's fucked, Nero somehow activ the staff in a way we have not seen -- AND THE BLADES APP

dialogues.speaker: NERO THRUSTS THE BLADES INTO AYEL
dialogues.text: TO THE FLOOR, DEAD! Nero's hard face turns to the rest of crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will return to Romulus when the Federation lies in ruins and not a moment before. When those who watched our people burn at last understand our pain, our loss. I refuse to return as a slave! We will return as conquerors!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE FACES OF THE MEN, SUBMITTING TO HIS WILL, our MUSI BUILDING -- and then, his eyes on Earth like a fucking LI a gazelle--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deploy the drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DRILL BAY DOORS open as they LOWER THE PLASMA DRILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign of Kirk and Spock.     Sulu's in the captain's ch Chekov at helm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chekov, transfer manual control to the Captain's chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye. (works controls) I've projected the parabolic course you must follow. If you deviate by so much as a meter, we will be detected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me one quarter impulse burst for five seconds and I'll do the rest with thrusters. On my mark. Three... two... one... fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The impulse engines SURGE, shutting off as the ship slips from behind the moon and into open space --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu makes rapid-fire thruster combinations to stay on tr a stealthy ballet of incredible dexterity. THE NARADA app over the horizon in geosynchronous orbit, passing underne Enterprise as they arc in behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All stop in three... two... one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small Enterprise pulls into position behind the massi Narada's BLIND SPOT and comes to a gentle stop. Tension -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transporter Room. We're in stable geosynchronous orbit behind the Narada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scanning) No sign they've detected us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK and SPOCK ready themselves for transport. STRAP ON U BELTS: COM-SETS, TRICORDERS, and of course, PHASERS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on Communicator) Well done, Mr. Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happens Mr. Sulu, if you feel you have a tactical advantage fire on that ship. Even if we're still aboard. It's an order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.   Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock turns to Uhura, who hands him a small TRANSLATOR DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be monitoring your frequency...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura gives the translator to Spock -- AND HE KISSES UHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Nyota.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They part, revealing KIRK'S SHOCKED FACE. Uhura walks off leaving the two men -- Kirk looking stunned at Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her first name is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no comment on the matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk still stunned as Scotty moves to transporter control

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's any common sense to their ship design, I'll be puttin' ya in a cargo bay, shouldn't be a soul in sight.

dialogues.speaker: FACING THE SAME DIRECTION FOR THE FIRST TIME
dialogues.text: - The moment of truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Energize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty hits the transport and Kirk and Spock DISAPPEAR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Spock MATERIALIZE in the cargo bay... to find themselves suddenly smack-dab in the middle of SIX ROMULA GUARDS working at cargo consoles!!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: For a split second they're as shocked as Kirk and Spock, they ATTACK -- Kirk immediately engages the closest Romul struggles -- but Spock's a machine: his palm snaps up CRA nose -- SLAMS a head against the wall -- as battle-ready Romulans are, it's like trying to catch a GHOST, Kirk fin knocks his one opponent unconscious, and turns to see it'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a touch insecure) Mine had a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am trained in the Vulcan martial art of Suus Mahna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Spock move to a still conscious Romulan as he st to get up. Spock reaches for the fallen Romulan's temples

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am unable to meld with these Romulans -- there are subtle differences in their physiology I did not anticipate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- punch him in the face -- make him talk! Suus Mahna his       -- Suss Mahna is only ass!                                for self-defense, he' -- then pretend it's a threat - - I'm your captain, that's an order! Spock PUNCHES the Romulan HARD -- and via Uhura's comlink translator, speaks in SUBTITLED ROMULAN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your computer access code?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard SPITS green blood at Spock, who PUNCHES him aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plasma drill is repaired and fully deployed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   Let's begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plasma beam SLAMS INTO SAN FRANCISCO BAY -- massive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cadets RUN to see the horrific sight of the plasma beam -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Uhura returns to the bridge, everyone's stations go DA STATIC on screens --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've activated the drill --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Communications and transporter inoperative --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkwardly)
