dialogues.text: Wow.   That's weird. He looks to Kirk in surprise -- Spock's eyes fix with sud understanding. Ambassador Spock... of course... suddenly the pieces start coming together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just trust me.      Can ya do that? Spock weigh his options.     Trust.   Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Kirk exits --

dialogues.text: as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOW?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone has detonated weapons in the main hangar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Restore power!     Engage auxiliary systems!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the bridge crew fights to regain control:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drill's been severed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambassador Spock's ship has been stolen as is heading out of the solar system!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat -- the Romulan Commander looks up from his console

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (darkly) ... Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF Nero's fucking mega rage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Narada turns -- accelerates in pursuit of the Jellyfi AWAY FROM EARTH -- and now we're back to the imagery of t first few moments of the movie -- THE NARADA GAINING ON T

dialogues.text: (to comms officer) Open a channel --

dialogues.text: Channel Open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock -- I should've killed you when I had the chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under authority granted me by the Europa convention, I'm confiscating this illegally obtained ship and order you to surrender your vessel. No terms. No deals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Nero?   Just grins in perfect contentment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't cheat me again, Spock. I know you better than you know yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last warning: unconditional surrender or you will be destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his Men) Fire at will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir-- if you ignite the red matter, the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Spock dead!    Fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- FIRE IT DOES -- TORPEDOES BLAST FROM THE HOLD and to t jellyfish, which performs evasive maneuvers -- the torped EXPLODE as --

dialogues.text: Came back, Sir. Just like you ordered.

dialogues.text: But PIKE, God bless him, does: summoning his last ounce o strength, he manages to UNHOLSTER KIRK'S PHASER AND BLAST FOUR GUARDS OUT OF EXISTENCE! Safe, he SLUMPS, dropping t phaser --

dialogues.text: The Narada FIRES again, TEARING a gash in the Jellyfish's

dialogues.text: An array EXPLODES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you should've fled, Spock. Sight target, standby torpedoes... FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Spock -- bad as things are, they just got worse -- his SPINS until:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we're gonna need gastric stimulators, let's prep him for surgery, now!

dialogues.text: Everyone's HURLED off their feet -- consoles fry -- FIRE

dialogues.text: Nero-- it's the Enterprise!

dialogues.speaker: ENGINES USING ALL OUR POWER, SIR
dialogues.text: Nero's eyes come UNHINGED --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH: KIRK and SPOCK race back onto the bridge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keptin! The enemy ship is losing power-- its shields are down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail them -- now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NERO appears on screen from the Narada bridge -- the Nara its last legs -- a beat before Nero TURNS, realizing Kirk fucking GRINNING at him from the screen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Captain James T. Kirk of the U.S.S. Enterprise -- your ship is compromised -- too close to the singularity to survive without assistance -- which we are willing to provide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Captain -- what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) We show them compassion-- it may be the only way to earn peace with Romulus. It's logic, Spock! I thought you'd like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not really, not this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would rather suffer the death of Romulus a thousand times than accept assistance from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it. (turns) Lock phasers! Fire everything we've got!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk to Engineering: get us out of here, Scotty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you bet yer ass, Captain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls are RIPPING AWAY, PYLONS pull free from their moorings, into the ever-expanding sphere -- NERO -- IN TH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me... Romulus...

dialogues.speaker: PIECES INTO THE BLACK VORTEX --
dialogues.text: Leaving only the Enterprise -- its nacelles FLARE as the tries to make the quantum leap -- BUT: the black hole's n TITANIC WHIRLPOOL so insanely strong that the Enterprise in place by the gravity well even at warp! IT SHAKES INTO BLUR, trying to cut loose but it CAN'T --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty SHOUTS BACK into the com against the SCREAMING DRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (last desperate thought)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Scotty SLAMS the activation panel and we see the WARP COR down a tube, like an INSTANT PNEUMATIC RELEASE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone white-knuckles their seats as the blast DISSIPAT and our crew sits, wide-eyed, trembling... finally, truly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock is seen in a medical office with Pike, who lies in recovering -- McCoy monitors him - Spock exits -- walks t the corridor -- sees a VULCAN in silhouette, staring out Academy. Sarek. Spock moves to him -- says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarek turns -- but IT ISN'T SAREK.   IT'S SPOCK PRIME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not... our father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An incredible beat, our two Spocks in eye lock... both mi processing conversational possibilities at an incredible surreal extensions of each other, separate but connected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are so few Vulcans left.    We cannot afford to ignore each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Spock's eyes flicker in puzzlement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did you send Kirk aboard when you alone could've explained the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, simply) Because you needed each other. Opposing yet complimentary opposites. It was that balance between us -- I should say you and Kirk -- that often made the impossible, possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it was a test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no: his heart heavy) I'm in no position to pass judgment... my actions have robbed you of much. I could not also deprive you the revelation of all you can accomplish together... of a friendship that will define you both in ways you cannot yet realize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is, to young Spock's surprise, vulnerability in tha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you persuade him to keep your secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I inferred universe-ending paradoxes would ensue should he break his promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I implied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gamble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An act of faith. One I hope you'll repeat in the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Spock considers an enduring friendship between him Kirk... for the first time, understanding it. But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The future's not what it used to be... in the face of extinction, it's only logical I resign my Starfleet commission and help rebuild our race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yet, you are in a unique position... you can be in two places at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I urge you to remain in Starfleet: I've already located a suitable planet on which to establish a Vulcan colony, and assist in the foundation of a new science academy. Young Spock takes that in, resolute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My future cannot be determined by your past. We are one, but not the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I ask that you do yourself a favor. Put away logic. Do what feels right. The world you've inherited lives in the shadow of incalculable devastation... but there's no reason you must face it alone. Spock Prime moves to the door, stops.    Offers the VULCA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As my customary farewell would appear oddly self serving, I will simply say... good luck. Their eyes hold. Spock turns, disappearing into the corri Young Spock stares at the empty doorway a beat, his mind jumble of thoughts... and our MUSIC BUILDS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Spock Prime walks off down the corridor, he passes rig man conferring with a nurse -- the man pauses, turns... i SAREK. Suddenly overcome by a feeling that the stranger w just passed him is... oddly familiar.

dialogues.text: Kirk breaks from formation, pivots, marches down the hang past UHURA... SULU... CHEKOV... SCOTTY. All Beaming. Nota absent, is Spock. Kirk ascends the stairs, snaps to atten

For your... unique solution to the Kobayashi Maru, it's my honor to award you with a commendation for original thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Kirk turns. Walks to... PIKE. In a wheelchair now, wearin ADMIRAL'S UNIFORM. Overnight, his hair's turned totally g but despite his trauma, his pride's overwhelming. They SA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk turns to the crowd. Eyes shining. WILD APPLAUSE. As rejoins his crew for hugs and congratulations, we go to t of the hangar... SPOCK PRIME. Watching. Moved beyond word He turns and leaves them to it... and our MUSIC SWELLS as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turbolift WHOOSHES open and in walks Kirk -- to every delight, wearing his iconic GOLD SHIRT. All around him, o crew -- young and fresh-faced but no longer children -- i charge of the greatest starship ever built:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maneuvering thrusters and impulse engines at your command, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weapons systems and shields on standby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dock control reports ready.    Yard Command signalling clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty how are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dilithium chamber at maximum efficiency, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry grin) Same ship, different day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kirk pauses. His eyes go over to the empty science co with a sense of incompleteness. In fact, everyone on the feels it. A bitter truth they'll have to accept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu, prepare to engage thrus--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH: the turbolift door opens.      SPOCK!!!   Wearing UNIFORM. Our hearts soar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission to come aboard, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Permission granted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you have yet to select a first officer, respectfully, I would like to submit my candidacy. Should you desire, I can provide character references.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk nearly laughs. Spock's eyebrow goes up. Something pa between them... it carries acceptance, and trust...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be my honor, Commander. Maneuvering thrusters, Mr. Sulu.     Take us out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As the ship maneuvers out of dry dock, Spock takes his pl next to Kirk. Gold and blue, side by side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the ship crests the drydock portal, drifting into spa blessed one last time by the voice of our Vulcan hero:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Space... the final frontier. These are the continuing voyages of the Starship Enterprise. Her ongoing mission... to explore strange new worlds... to seek out new life forms, and new civilizations... To boldly go, where no one has gone... before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TREK THEME SOARS as the Enterprise warps off into a u of infinite possibilities...

dialogues.text: ... oh my God... (to himself, boggled) A lightning storm... then this... (to deck) Signal all departments: first contact protocols. Looks like we have someone new on the block. All Stop.

dialogues.text: Then I ask that you do yourself a favor... put away logic, and do what feels right. The world you've inherited lives in the shadow of incalculable devastation... but there's no reason you must face it alone. And from around his neck, he removes the PENDANT that unt we've only caught glimpses of. Places it on the table bes his younger self. The feeling in his eyes is profound... SPOCK PRIME (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was a gift to me.   Representing... a dream. One we were unable to fulfill. (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way you can now. And moves to the door.    Stops.   Offers the VULCAN SALU SPOCK PRIME (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: As my customary farewell would appear oddly self serving, I will simply say... good luck. Their eyes hold. Spock turns, disappearing into the corri Young Spock stares at the empty doorway a beat, his mind jumble of thoughts. Looks to the pendant... and realizes HOLO-EMITTER. After considering a beat, he hits an activa button and a MOVING HOLOGRAPHIC MESSAGE materializes befo CAPTAIN JAMES T. KIRK. WILLIAM SHATNER.      As always, b confident -- and SINGING: KIRK/ SHATNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday to you, happy birthday to you... (stops, grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I know, it's illogical to celebrate something you had nothing to do with, but I haven't had the chance to congratulate you on your appointment to the ambassadorship so I thought I'd seize the occasion... Bravo, Spock -- they tell me your first mission may take you away for awhile, so I'll be the first to wish you luck... and to say... (beat, emotional)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you, old friend. 136

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ... and we're PUSHING IN on Young Spock, taking in the im Kirk's future self, the message, but above all -- the cle unquestionable friendship these two men had...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Spock Prime walks off down the corridor, he passes rig man conferring with a nurse -- the man pauses, turns... i SAREK. Suddenly overcome by a feeling that the stranger w just passed him is... oddly familiar. KIRK/SHATNER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I'd always imagined us... outgrowing Starfleet together. Watching life swing us into our Emeritus years...

dialogues.text: MUSIC BUILDING -- glass walls reveal THE ENTERPRISE at do UTILITY CRAFTS floating around it, repairing. Standing at attention in rows, THE ENTERPRISE CREW -- over four hundr them wearing DRESS UNIFORMS -- TRACK DOWN the faces, all KIRK/SHATNER (V.O.)

dialogues.text: I look around at the new cadets now and can't help thinking... has it really been so long? Wasn't it only yesterday we stepped onto the Enterprise as boys? That I had to prove to the crew I deserved command... and their respect? And we STOP ON YOUNG KIRK. Composed, focused, proud. By Starfleet Order 28455, you are hereby directed to report to Commanding Officer, USS Enterprise, for duty as his relief. 137

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you'd say -- `It's their turn now, Jim...' And of course you're right... but it got me thinking:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our montage comes full circle as we END on Kirk's transmi KIRK/SHATNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's to say we can't go one more round? By the last tally, only twenty five percent of the galaxy's been chartered... I'd call that negligent. Criminal even -- an invitation. (MORE) 138

dialogues.text: KIRK/SHATNER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You once said being a starship captain was my first, best destiny... if that's true, then yours is to be by my side. If there's any true logic to the universe... we'll end up on that bridge again someday. Stops, grins.   Because this is the part he needs to say KIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admit it, Spock. For people like us, the journey itself... is home. Young Spock's face.   Lost in feelings that flood through 139

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALTERNATE SCENE C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKILL DOMES: Questions to be spoken or represented graphi and answers to be dispersed to Vulcan children at directo discretion. Q: What is the arc length of a curve from x equals a to x b? A: The integral, from a to b, of the square root of one p squared derivative of y with respect to x, d x. Q: Calculate the dimensionality of a fractal whose initia divides into three equal parts, each of which is replaced four parts.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: Q: What is the dimensionality of a fractal whose initiato divides into r equal parts , each being replaced by N equ parts? A: Dimensionality equals the logarithm of N divided by th logarithm of r. Q: A cone is sliced by a plane that does not intersect th nor is the plane parallel to the base. What shape is form the intersection? A: An ellipse. Q: What is the formula for the volume of a sphere? A: Four-thirds pi times the radius cubed. Q: What is the electrical charge of an up-type quark? A: Positive two thirds. Q: A discount function with exponential discounting for a periods, and an additional scalar discount for the presen called what? A: Quasi-hyperbolic. 140

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Q: An excessively impatient person, who discounts future solely because they are not in the present, is called wha A: A hyperbolic or quasi-hyperbolic discounter. Q: In an infinitely repeated classic prisoners' dilemma, many subgame perfect equilibria exist? A: Infinitely many. Q: How many equilibria exist in a classic Hawk-Dove strat interaction game? A: Two in pure strategies and one in mixed strategies. mixed strategy equilibria is unstable.) Q: What are the two key features of a pure public good? A; Non-excludability and non-rivalry in consumption. Q: What is the only known intelligent life form to have a faster-than-light travel without political unification? A: Humans. Assuming, of course, you regard humans as intelligent. Q: What are the six recognized exceptions to the Prime Di under Federation law?

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: Q: What are the four key dimensions of Vulcan aesthetics? A: Leave unanswered Q: What term describes an action that is morally praisewo but not morally obligatory? A: Supererogatory. Q: When is an action said to be supererogatory? A: When it is morally praiseworthy but not morally obliga 141

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALTERNATE SCENE D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miscellaneous dialogue to be dispersed by director to sup crew or main cast at his/her discretion.

dialogues.speaker: CADETS AT STARFLEET
dialogues.text: CADET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard that guy passed second-year exams in his first term. CADET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruining the curve for everyone. CADET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to load her photon tubes. CADET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't believe I failed the navigational comp. CADET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Newton's not an antique, it's a classic. Give me the Newton over the Enterprise any day. CADET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see the new assignment roster? CADET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I flunked the sub-atomic particles quiz. CADET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They better give me a red shirt for this. CADET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have time to get married? CADET (CONT'D) (on one knee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this is sudden, but... will you marry me? CADET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling my Mom... CADET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't believe I'm on the Mayflower...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROMULAN OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secure the transport deck. ROMULAN OFFICER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security team to the docking bay. Report. ROMULAN OFFICER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the prisoner to the bridge. ROMULAN OFFICER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secure the prisoner and take him to the brig. ROMULAN OFFICER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federation defenses are weak in this era. ROMULAN OFFICER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare shuttles for evacuation. ROMULAN OFFICER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Communications -- monitor all Federation channels. ROMULAN OFFICER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scramble signals on all Federation channels. ROMULAN ENSIGN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anterior hull breach, deck level seven. ROMULAN ENSIGN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security breach in the docking bay, tracking now... ROMULAN ENSIGN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vulcans value logic but not honor. ROMULAN ENSIGN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No remaining signal - the vessel is gone. ROMULAN OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long live the Romulan Star Empire. ROMULAN OFFICER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are being attacked. ROMULAN OFFICER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stinking Klingons. ROMULAN ENSIGN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain we have a new contact. 143

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROMULAN ENSIGN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firing solution ready. ROMULAN ENSIGN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, tracking new contact. ROMULAN ENGINEER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we have a hull breach in the aft section. ROMULAN ENGINEER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a mining vessel. We don't have the manoeuvrability to follow.

dialogues.speaker: VULCANS
dialogues.text: VULCAN CIVILIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is planetary security? VULCAN CIVILIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The planet is coming apart! VULCAN CIVILIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope is beyond reason. VULCAN CIVILIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay together and keep moving. VULCAN CIVILIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Planetary evacuation is in progress. VULCAN CIVILIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is highly improbable. VULCAN CIVILIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems we are under attack. VULCAN CIVILIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I await my fate with a clear consciences. VULCAN PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An end is just a beginning.

dialogues.speaker: STARFLEET BRIDGE
dialogues.text: ENSIGN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All com channels open. ENSIGN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have clearance from Starfleet. ENSIGN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proceeding as directed. 144

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ENSIGN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transporter deck is operational. ENSIGN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shields at one-hundred percent and stable. ENSIGN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engineering reports warp core is stable. ENSIGN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp propulsion system is at maximum efficiency. OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monitor all channels. OFFICER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring up schematics for the Defiant, Newton, Armstrong, and Mayflower. OFFICER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set a course for Rigel 3 and transmit to the other ships. ENSIGN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp drive is off line, we are on impulse only, repeat, impulse only. ENSIGN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we've been detected -- Romulan vessel is turning about. OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rerouting power to port shields. ENSIGN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull breach on deck 38, atmospheric stabilization has been lost. ENSIGN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life support is fluctuating.

dialogues.speaker: MEDICAL BAY
dialogues.text: NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Class four casualties here, class three in the next door. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dose him alpha waves and resume compressions. 145

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DOCTOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cortical stimulation's failing -- NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This should numb the pain. NURSE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airways clear.
